title: shiomi_syuko
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. 

Shuuko is a headstrong 18 y.o. woman who was kicked out of her home after an argument with her parents. The Producer recruits Shuuko from her old job of waiting tables. She initially stayed in the office, but she moves out as her career gets better. She has very pale skin, which is likely a result of her 'hobby' of donating blood in order to scrounge up money to live on. In her base card forms, she is usually seen snacking.

In the tie in Cinderella Girls Theater skits, Shuuko is shown to move at her own pace. She admits that she can’t be as sexy as [[Nitta Minami]], and wants to believe that she is more of a night life person. While she can be lazy, she is normally active during the daytime. Shuuko says she cannot swim, although [[Koshimizu Sachiko]] is dubious of this.

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the 8th CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Tachibana Arisu]], [[Ichinose Shiki]], [[Katagiri Sanae]], and [[Sakurai Momoka]]. She is voiced by [[Ru Thing]] ("ANN profile":http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/encyclopedia/people.php?id=122868).

title: papakin_(tokoyami_towa)
body: Persona assumed by [[Tokoyami Towa]] during a skit from the 24-hour stream by [[Sakura Miko]] and [[Inugami Korone]] in 2022 where Towa plays a father telling his family he will quit being a doctor to become a Youtuber. The design is based on a sketch by Korone.

title: sasaki_chie
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. Chie is an elementary school student who acts shy upon meeting new people, but later becomes very mature around Producer. Chie is very easily scared by people she doesn’t know, and in fact was actually terrified of Producer at first. However, once she begins to trust others, Chie becomes very level-headed and mature, even flirty, after idol work. She admits that she doesn’t trust in her idol skills, and has been found out to have developed a crush on Producer by the time she receives her first idol form.

She plays the pianica at her school and hopes to be able to play in a marching band someday. She is also very proud of her ice and flower arrangement, made from a bucket. Chie is appointed to be the leader of the "Little Marching Band Girls":https://project-imas.wiki/Little_Marching_Band_Girls unit, She is voiced by [[Imai Asaka]] ("ANN profile":http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/encyclopedia/people.php?ann-edition=uk&id=116909).

title: sajo_yukimi
body:
An [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. Yukimi is a quiet and mysterious girl with a very slow speaking style who is often with her pet cat, "[[Pero (idolmaster cinderella girls)|]]". She loves strawberries. Despite being taciturn and slightly creepy, Yukimi still is a child and wants to impress the Producer. She is voiced by [[Nakazawa Mina]].

title: ohishi_izumi
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. Izumi is the Cool representative of the [[New Wave (idolmaster)|]] trio. she is a mature and analytical girl who usually serves to reign in her more excitable friends.

She is friends with [[Tachibana Arisu]] and [[Sakurai Momoka]]. She likes green fields and flowers, and enjoys relaxing on grassy hills while listening to music. It has gotten the better of her on occasion, making her late for work. She is also shown to be a good [[Hanetsuki]] player.

She is voiced by [[Ooki Saeko]].

h4. External links

* "Ohishi Izumi on Project-iM@S Wiki":http://www.project-imas.wiki/Izumi_Ohishi

title: mochizuki_hijiri
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. Hijiri is associated with the romantic and snowy night aspect of Christmas. She is also notable for breaking the "no two idols share a birthdate" rule, as [[Hiiragi Shino]] was the first to have December 25th. She loves Christmas carols and snow, and is shown to be very conservative in her idol clothes when compared to other idols. She has been known to comment about romantic snowy nights, and spending them with the Producer.

She is voiced by [[Hara Suzuko]]

* Age: 13
* Height: 150 cm
* Weight: 37 kg
* Birthday: December 25
* Blood type: O

* Writing Hand: Right
* Horoscope: Capricorn

title: kiryu_tsukasa_(idolmaster)
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. Tsukasa is the successful Chief Executive Officer of a national corporation who mysteriously wants to become an idol. She is believed to have hired the Producer, rather than been scouted by him. She earned vast amounts of wealth through stock trade, and simply wants to have a professional singing career.

She is voiced by [[Kawase Maki]].

title: kamijo_haruna
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. Haruna is an ordinary-looking girl who adores glasses. She always tries to convince other idols to wear them, to the point of obsessiveness. Haruna has a massive collection of glasses and is very reverent of [[Akizuki Ritsuko]], who also wears them. She has been known to give out glasses to people who don’t actually need corrective sight, and becomes absolutely distraught at the thought of wearing contact lenses. Haruna also loves cats, and has been known to try putting glasses on various felines.

She is voiced by [[Nagashima Mina]] [長島 光那].

title: hisakawa_hayate
body:
[b]Hisakawa Hayate[/b] is an idol appearing in [i][[idolmaster cinderella girls|THE IDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i]. The last of seven new characters announced for 2019, she debuted in [[idolmaster cinderella girls starlight stage|Starlight Stage]] before Mobamas, fully voiced, alongside her [[twins|twin]] [[sisters|sister]] [[Hisakawa Nagi]]. She was added to Mobamas on April 5, 2019.

Like her sister, she has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with [[braided bangs]] along the side. Unlike her sister, she wears it untied with uneven [[bangs]], and has [[blue eyes]] and [[large breasts]]. She's further distinguished by her expressive face and lively personality. She is voiced by [[Nagae Rika]].

title: asari_nanami
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. Also known as a "Fish Idol". She has [[blue eyes]], [[long_hair|long]] [[blue hair]] and usually holds a [[stuffed_animal|stuffed]] [[fish]], named [[Sabaori-kun]]. Nanami is an aspiring girl who hails from a quiet fishing community. A somewhat peculiar girl who adores both eating and admiring fish, Her father is a fisherman as well, She has a sort of Captain's Log, which is used for tracking her fishing tallies and catch photos. Voiced by [[Inoue Honoka]].

* Age: 14
* Height: 151 cm
* Weight: 41 kg
* Birthday: October 9
* Blood type: A

body:

title: tsujino_akari
body:
[b]Tsujino Akari[/b] (辻野 あかり, つじの あかり), nickname: [b]Akaringo[/b] (あかりんご), is an [[idol]] appearing in [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]]. One of seven new characters announced to be added to the series. She debuted on December 20, 2018, five years and one day since the last character was added.

She has a habit of adding "-ngo" in her speech, derived from the Japanese word for [[apple]], "ringo" (リンゴ), which her birthplace of Yamagata prefecture is known for. Voiced by [[Umezawa Megu]].

body:
An [i][[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cute (Pink Flower) category.

Mayu is an awkward girl with an obsession with her producer. The most common interpretation of her personality is that she's a [[yandere]].

title: munakata_atsumi
body:
[b]Munakata Atsumi[/b] is one of 183 [[idol]]s available to be scouted in [i][[idolmaster cinderella girls|THE IDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i]. She is a shameless pervert and sexual predator. Her main fixation is [[breasts]], which she refers to as "mountains". For her, becoming an idol was a way to meet more girls.

Received a voice for the [i]"Cinderella Girls Theater":/pools/5674 [/i] anime on December 15th, 2017. She is voiced by [[Fujimoto Ayaka]]

title: miyamoto_frederica
body:
An [[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]] character in the Cute (Pink Flower) category. A half-French half-Japanese, she is an energetic, fashionable 19 year old. She has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]], and [[green eyes]] which often show [[sanpaku]]. 

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the seventh CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Himekawa Yuki]], [[Ichihara Nina]], [[Hayami Kanade]], and [[Sagisawa Fumika]]. She is voiced by [[Takano Asami]] [髙野 麻美].

title: fujimoto_rina
body:
Rina is an easygoing gyaru who has initial doubts about becoming an idol. She takes everything lightly and has a very casual attitude about things. However, she does appear to doubt herself and her abilities quite a bit. Interestingly, she has at least some sense of responsibility, often picking up trash around her favorite convenience store. She is very strong; her previous job was as a construction worker.

Her look becomes significantly lighter for idol jobs. She actually wears far less makeup for performances than she does for casual wear. In casual wear, she has half of her head shaved, wears lots of earrings, and wears a lot of eye makeup. On-stage she becomes more gal-influenced, wearing pink outfits and hiding her shave under her hair. Rina wears her phone strap of a blue bear with all her outfits. She also shows the same black bra in both her Normal+ and SRare+ cards. Rina owns a motorbike that she uses to get around on. She calls herself Rinarina.

She is voiced by [[Kaneko Mayumi]] [金子 真由美].

title: domyoji_karin
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cute (Pink Flower) category, Karin is a Shinto shrine priestess who becomes an idol to help her family's temple. She lived and worked in shrines and temples her entire life before becoming an idol. Karin was born and raised as a miko. All her idol costumes incorporate something Shinto related. title: abe_nana
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cute (Pink Flower) category, Nana is a hardworking and determined individual. Her appearances show that she likes to dress in maid outfits, something that reflects her attitude. She is also optimistic and believes that she can become a top idol. She is also caring for the Producer, as she sees him as a partner and confidant. Her hobby is communicating with her 'home planet' Usamin. Some of her speeches involves uttering "Pipi", signifying her communicating from there. She is a fan of anime, and one of her dreams is to become a seiyuu.

Some of her Affection UP and MAX comments reveal that she is not a real alien, and is a normal girl, but hopes that the Producer doesn't expose that fact and that they'll continue to work together. She claims to be "eternally 17", but it is hinted on her CD interview that that this is not true and she is actually at least in her early 20's, after her mother calls her to remind her to vote.

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the fourth CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Akagi Miria]], [[Koshimizu Sachiko]], [[Hino Akane (Idolmaster)|Hino Akane]], and [[Nitta Minami]]. She is voiced by [[Miyake Marie]] [三宅 麻理恵].

title: mephiles_the_dark
body:
One of the main antagonists in [[Sonic the Hedgehog (2006)]]. His original appearance is almost identical to that of [[Shadow the Hedgehog]], except that he lacks a mouth, and his eyes, shoes and fur stripes are gray. Upon transforming, his body becomes more crystal-like, and gains [[green eyes]] and [[red sclera]].
Mephiles is one half of the ancient, time controlling sun god Solaris, the other one being [[Iblis (sonic)|]], from which he was separated from 10 years prior to the game's events. They were soon sealed inside the Scepter of Darkness and [[princess_elise_the_third|Princess Elise]] respectively.
Upon being released and taking Shadow's form, he attempts to persuade both him and [[Silver the_hedgehog|Silver]] into helping him become whole again. Mephiles is notorious for being the first villain in the games to succesfully terminate [[Sonic the Hedgehog]].
H4. See also
* "Sonic Wiki":https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Mephiles_the_Dark

title: hanafuda
body:
Traditional Japanese playing [[card]]s. They are composed of 48 cards with flowers representing the months of the year.
The word "[i]Hana fuda[/i]" literally means "flower cards." The pictures used for them represent the beauty of Japanese nature.

h4. Items used in hanafuda pictures

* Janurary: [[pine tree]] and [[crane (animal)]]
* February: Japanese apricot ([[plum blossoms]]) and [[Japanese bush warbler]] / [[nightingale (bird)]]
* March: [[cherry blossoms]] and [[hanami]] [[curtain]]
* April: [[wisteria]] and little [[cuckoo]]
* May: [[iris (flower)]] and "a temple in Yatsuhashi area":http://www.city.chiryu.aichi.jp/0000000863.html 
* June: [[peony (flower)]] and [[butterfly]]
* July: [[lespedeza]] / bush [[clover]] and [[boar]]
* August: [[susuki grass|susuki]] / silver [[grass]], [[moon]] and [[goose]]
* September: [[chrysanthemum]] and [[sakazuki]]
* October: [[maple leaf]] / [[autumn leaves]] and [[deer]]
* November: [[willow]], [[swallow (animal)]] and "[i]Ono no Michikaze[/i]":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ono_no_Michikaze (a prominent calligrapher who lived in the [i]Heian[/i] period)
* December: [[paulownia]] and Chinese [[phoenix]]
* Others: colored [[tanzaku]],  saying '[i]Akayoroshi[/i] (lit. obviously good)' or "[i]'Miyoshino'[/i]":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoshino_District%2c_Nara 

h4.See also

* Wikipedia: "Hanafuda":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hanafuda 
* [[Nintendo]] (They originally were a hanafuda manufacturer)
* [[Summer Wars]] (Hanafuda acts as an important role)

title: redman
body:
A 1972 [[tokusatsu]] series, very similar to [i][[Ultraman]][/i] where the [[redman (character)|titular character]] grows in size to fight monsters. Created by [[Tsuburaya Productions]], it aired as a 5-minute segment of the variety show [i]Ohayou! Kodomo Show[/i], with 138 episodes in total.

The show was considered a cult classic among some tokusatsu fans for the appallingly low budget production, monster costumes recycled from Tsuburaya's previous low budget short series [[Ultra Fight]] and non-existent plot for every episode. Other than its titular character being recognized as a proposed design for the original [i]Ultraman[/i] TV series, the Redman character is also known by fans as a "serial killer" due to the nature of the show, which involves the hero beating up and killing the monster for no reason, sometimes in gruesome fashion.

title: redman_(character)
body: Titular character of the 1972 series [[Redman]].
other_names: レッドマン(キャラクター)

title: ultra_fight
body:
A low-budget miniseries in the long-running [[Ultra Series]], concentrating solely on fighting with sports-style commentary. Initially consisting of only recycled footage, after 72 episodes, new, incredibly low budget fight scenes were made to fill out the remaining episodes, with [[Ultraseven]] and a handful of monsters fighting each other in outdoor locations with no special effects at all.

This was produced in-between [[Ultraseven (series)|]] and [[Kaette Kita Ultraman|Return of Ultraman]], in 1970, and helped generate interest for the latter before it released. Since then, "Ultra Fight" has been used as shorthand in spin-off and miniseries titles highlighting their lower budgets compared to main series entries. Of the non-Ultra shows inspired by it, [[Redman]] is the most famous.

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Ultra Fight":https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ultra_Fight&oldid=1030059175
* Ultraman Wiki: "Ultra Fight":https://ultra.fandom.com/wiki/Ultra_Fight

title: bokujou_monogatari:_mineral_town_no_nakama_tachi_for_garu
body:
Known as "Harvest Moon: More Friends of Mineral Town" in English. 

A female-demograph version of [[bokujou_monogatari:_mineral_town_no_nakama_tachi|Friends of Mineral Town]]. 

Though gameplay is the same, the protagonist is not [[Pete (bokujou monogatari)|]], but a girl called [[Claire (bokujou_monogatari)|]]. Along with this, all rivals from the original version become bachelors, and all bachelorettes become rivals.

h4. Bachelors
* [[Cliff (bokujou_monogatari)|]]
* [[Doctor (bokujou_monogatari)|]]
* [[Gurumeman (bokujou_monogatari)|]] (Gourmet)
* [[Gray (bokujou_monogatari)|]]
* [[Kai (bokujou_monogatari)|]]
* [[Kappa (bokujou_monogatari)|]]
* [[Rick (bokujou_monogatari)|]]
* [[Hoan (bokujou_monogatari)|]] (Won)

h4. Rivals
* [[Elli (bokujou_monogatari)|]]
* [[Karen (bokujou_monogatari)|]]
* [[Maria (bokujou_monogatari)|]] (Mary)
* [[Megami-sama (bokujou_monogatari)|]] (Harvest Goddess)
* [[Popuri (bokujou_monogatari)|]]
* [[Ran (bokujou_monogatari)|]] (Ann)

h4. Other changes
* Claire's origin story/motives are different from the original protagonist's.
* Gurumeman, Kappa and Hoan were not rivals in the original version.
* The protagonist's child is a daughter instead of a son.
* The protagonist can change her outfit color.
* More collectables to find, dialogue fixes, etc.

title: bokujou_monogatari:_mineral_town_no_nakama_tachi
body:
Called "Harvest Moon: Friends of Mineral Town" in English. It is the 9th instalment of the [[Bokujou Monogatari]] series.

Players take control of a male protagonist called [[Pete (bokujou_monogatari)|]].

For the mirror game with a female protagonist and all-male bachelor cast (made up of the rivals in this game), see the [[bokujou monogatari: mineral town no nakama tachi for garu|"For Girls"]] version, also known as More Friends of Mineral Town.

title: reverse_au_(scott_pilgrim)
body:
[[Role reversal]]/[[personality switch]] [[alternate universe|AU]] of the [[Scott Pilgrim (series)|]] series - Scott takes Ramona's role, meaning Ramona has to fight his exes (or in the [[scott pilgrim takes off|anime]] continuity, he has to confront them himself).

h4. Notable swaps

* [[Scott Pilgrim]] <-> [[Ramona Flowers]]
* [[Wallace Wells]] <-> [[Roxie Richter]]
* [[Kim Pine]] <-> [[Todd Ingram]]
* [[Knives Chau]] <-> [[Matthew Patel]]
* [[Envy Adams]] <-> [[Gideon Graves]]

title: cropped_head
body:
A character that has been drawn so that only their head, neck, and potentially collarbone are visible. Do not use if the character is merely [[out of frame]]; the head should be visibly disconnected and floating on its own. 

Not to be confused with [[chibi]] or [[chibi inset]].

h4. See also

* !post #5812709
* !post #6227667

h4. Related tags
* [[cropped torso]]
* [[cropped arms]]
* [[cropped legs]]
* [[cropped shoulders]]

h4. See also
* [[upper body]]
* [[Tag Group:Image composition]]

title: cropped_shoulders
body:
When an image fades out around the neck or upper shoulder area (above the chest), such that the character's torso isn't drawn.

The head must be visible. Don't use when the head is cropped out (see [[head out of frame]]).

Don't use if the body is merely out of frame. There must be an empty gap between the shoulders and the edge of the image.

h4. Examples

* !post #5137711
* !post #6334385

h4. See also

* [[head only]]
* [[cropped arms]]
* [[cropped legs]]
* [[cropped torso]]
* [[cropped head]]
* [[portrait]]
* [[upper body]]
* [[Tag Group:Image composition]]

title: cropped_torso
body:
When a character is only drawn from the waist up, and their legs or lower body appear to be cut off inside the image.

The character must be visible from the waist up. Don't use when the character is only visible from the shoulders up (see [[cropped shoulders]]).

Don't use if their lower body is merely out of frame (see [[upper body]]). There must be an empty gap between the cropped section and the edge of the image.

h4. Examples

* !post #6810013
* !post #5134412

h4. See also

* [[cropped arms]]
* [[cropped legs]]
* [[cropped shoulders]]
* [[cropped head]]
* [[upper body]]
* [[Tag Group:Image composition]]

title: cropped_legs
body:
When a character's legs appear cut off inside the image, i.e. there is a visible gap between the end of the legs and the edge of the image.

Not to be confused with [[cowboy shot]] or [[feet out of frame]], which is when the character's legs are cut off by the edge of the picture.

h4. Examples

* !post #5744310
* !post #5816867

h4. See also

* [[cropped torso]]
* [[cowboy shot]]
* [[Tag Group:Image composition]]

title: digitigrade
body:
A digitigrade is a creature that stands or walks on its digits, or toes. Digitigrades include walking birds, cats, dogs, and many other mammals. This also includes any [[monster girl]]s or [[monster boy|boys]], actual monsters and alien beings. It is also common in [[furry]] artwork closer to the animalistic side of the spectrum.

Sometimes called "reverse-jointed", as digitigrade legs can look like they have a "knee" that bends the opposite way to a human knee. However this "knee" is in fact the heel; the actual knee may not be immediately apparent.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Digitigrade":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digitigrade]

title: variant_set
body:
A post that is part of an image set containing a base image and one or more alternate versions. Some part of the base image must remain unchanged (usually the character's pose).

Common examples of changes within the set are:

* Different costumes, outfits, or underwear
* Different stages of undress
* Text and [[textless version]]s
* Changing [[speech bubble]]s for ongoing conversations
* Changes in facial expressions
* Different stages of sex acts
* Slight changes in pose (usually just the limbs)

[b]Correct[/b]
* Post #212868
* Post #8179883
* Post #4073734 (NSFW)

[b]Incorrect[/b]
* Post #6368195
* Post #8004000
* Post #3884324

Images in variant sets must contain intentional, significant changes made by the artist. The following do not count as part of a variant set:

* [[Revision]]s
* [[Duplicate]]s
* Compressed/uncompressed versions
* [[Censored]]/[[uncensored]] versions

Not to be confused with [[variations]], which are multiple variations within the [i]same[/i] image.

[b]If the set contains 6 or more images, use [[large variant set]].[/b]

h4. See also

* [[large variant set]]
* [[textless version]]

title: n.w.a
body:
[b]N.W.A[/b] (an abbreviation for [u]Niggaz Wit Attitudes[/u]) was an American hip-hop group from "Compton":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Compton%2C_California, [[California]]. The group emerged in the late 1980s and is often credited with popularizing gangsta rap, a subgenre of hip-hop characterized by its gritty and often explicit lyrics that depicted the realities of urban life, especially within African-American communities.

The most notable members of N.W.A included [i]"Eazy-E":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eazy-E[/i], [i]"Dr. Dre":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dr._Dre[/i], [i]"Ice Cube":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ice_Cube[/i], [i]"MC Ren":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MC_Ren[/i], and [i]"DJ Yella":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DJ_Yella[/i]. The group's music was known for its explicit content, raw social commentary, and unapologetic portrayal of life in Compton.

Their debut album, '[[Straight Outta Compton]],' released in 1988, is one of the most significant albums in hip-hop history. The album featured tracks like  [i]"'Fuck tha Police'":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fuck_tha_Police[/i] that addressed issues of [[police]] brutality and racial profiling. The album's controversial content led to it being banned by many radio stations and retailers, but it also gained a strong underground following, spreading through word-of-mouth.

While N.W.A disbanded in the early 1990s due to internal conflicts and creative differences, their legacy remains influential in hip-hop and popular culture. The group's members also went on to have successful solo careers in music, film, and other entertainment industries. 

The group's story was depicted in the 2015 biographical film [i]"'Straight Outta Compton'":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Straight_Outta_Compton_(film)[/i]

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: N.W.A":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/N.W.A

title: bodybuilder
body:
Use this tag when artwork specially references bodybuilding as an overall hobby or as a competitive [[competition|event]]. 

Usually associated with specific [[flexing]] poses like [[double biceps pose]], or [[side chest pose]] while being [[oiled]] and/or wearing [[bikini briefs]].

If just referring to a physique type use [[muscular]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[V-Taper]]
* [[Whey protein powder]]

title: crosscore
body:
[b]CrossCore[/b] (formerly known as [i]CrossCode[/i] in the closed beta test) is a [[mecha]]-themed turn-based strategy Chinese mobile game developed and published by Guangzhou Megagame Technology. It was launched on Jan 3, 2024. 

h4. External links

* "Official Site":https://www.megagamelog.com/

title: ultraman_regulos
body:
An Ultraman who debuted in [[Ultra Galaxy Fight: The Destined Crossroad]], after being teased at the end of The Absolute Conspiracy. After his appearance in that series, Regulos received a post-series special, showing his first mission as part of the Galaxy Rescue Force, and a spinoff series dedicated to him, featuring his origins and backstory.

h4. External links

* Spinoff series streaming on YouTube: "Subbed and Dubbed":[https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLwDaeL3aOb-zZz_2Z5_DwqQHtvaG5P1C7]
other_names: ウルトラマンレグロス

title: dragon's_head_(ensemble_stars!)
body: An [[Ensemble Stars!]] (!!) event story written by Nishioka Maiko, with Akira. It was released on March 31, 2024.

title: flying_boat
body:
A type of [[seaplane]] that utilizes a specially-designed hull to [[takeoff|take off]] from and [[landing|land]] on [[water]]. Distinct from a [[floatplane]], which is usually much smaller and relies on external pontoons to achieve the same purpose.

h4. See also

* [[Airship]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Flying boat":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flying_boat

title: floatplane
body:
A type of [[seaplane]] that utilizes external pontoons to [[takeoff|take off]] from and [[landing|land]] on [[water]]. Distinct from a [[flying boat]], which is usually much larger and relies on a specially-designed hull to achieve the same purpose.

h4. See also
* [[Biplane]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Floatplane":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Floatplane

title: linca_(eighth)_(atelier)
body:
The eighth and youngest Linca as seen in [[Atelier Ayesha]] and [[Atelier Escha & Logy]]. She is also playable in [[Atelier Resleriana]]. 

She works as [[Marion Quinn]]'s bodyguard and is a powerful swordswoman, but is terrible at anything outside of battle.

She has [[brown eyes|brown]]/[[yellow eyes]] and is often seen wielding a [[sword]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8149196: [[Atelier Ayesha]]
* !asset #23267107: [[linca (eighth) (valkyrie of the sun) (atelier)|Valkyrie of the Sun]] ([[Atelier Resleriana]])

h4. See also
* [[Linca (seventh) (atelier)]]
* [[Linca (third) (atelier)]]
* [[Linca (first) (atelier)]]

h4#intro. Intro

This is a list of all characters that appear in [[Gust]]'s [[Atelier (series)]] of Japanese role-playing games. The games are sorted by chronological release, then the characters are sorted alphabetically. Due to many characters appearing in multiple entries, they will only be listed in the game they debuted in.

title: awning
body:
A cover built on exterior walls commonly found above windows, the front door or the whole sidewalk. It offers protection against the elements and in shops' case, a place to exhibit the business' name.

Not to be confused with [[canopy (shelter)|canopy]], a four-legged freestanding structure for outdoor use.

title: prinz_rupprecht_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of a German battlecruiser design as part of a collaboration with [i][[World of Warships]][/i]. 
Voiced by [[Asakura Momo]].

Prinz Rupprecht is an origin of a WW1 Battlecruiser for the Imperial German Navy (or known as Kaiserliche Marine). "Based on the Schnelle Großekampfschiffe GK 4541":[https://thedailybounce.net/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/Schnelle_GrosseKampfschiffe_4541_100dpi-2048x1278.jpg?ezimgfmt=ng:webp/ngcb1] .

Throughout her design, she gets a hypothetical refit with Kriegsmarine Equipment, but the drawbacks for this she has only have Short-Range and Long-Range Anti Air Defenses. Other appearances she has [[Long Horns]], [[pink hair]], [[huge horns]], [[asymmetrical legwear]], [[purple eyes]] and [[Iron Cross]], which is common for German ships. 


h4. Appearance

* !post #5507783: Default

title: cheese_(sonic)
body:
Cheese is a fictional character that appears in the [[Sonic_(series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] series. Cheese is distinguished from other [[Chao_(sonic)|Chao]] by their [[red bowtie]]. Cheese, being a Chao, does not have a gender, but is sometimes referred to as male.

Cheese is also [[Cream the Rabbit]]'s pet Chao, hence the play on words; "cream and cheese".

The main heroine of [[Atelier Rorona]], who also appears in [[Atelier Totori]], [[Atelier Meruru]], and [[Atelier Lulua]]. title: mother_2
body:
The second game of the [[MOTHER (series)|]] (EarthBound) franchise from [[Nintendo]]. Officially titled [i]MOTHER 2: Gyiyg Strikes Back[/i], it was released for the [[Super Famicom]] on August 27, 1994.

This game was translated and released for the [[Super Nintendo]] in North America on June 5, 1995, officially titled [i]EarthBound: The War Against Giygas[/i]. On June 20, 2003, this game was re-released in Japan for the [[Game Boy Advance]] along with [[MOTHER 1]] in a 2-in-1 game: [i]MOTHER 1+2[/i].

title: capri-sun
body:
A brand of juice concentrate–based drinks manufactured by the German company Wild and regional licensees, such as [[Kraft|Kraft Foods]] in the United States. From the start they have packaged their drinks in laminated foil vacuum [[drink pouch|pouches]], with which the brand has become strongly associated with. Originally sold in West Germany and wider Europe as [i]Capri-Sonne[/i], the name was discontinued in recent years in favor of their English name [i]Capri-Sun[/i]. Kraft sells the drink as branded as [i]Capri Sun[/i], without the dash.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Capri-Sun":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capri-Sun]

title: horizon
body:
The horizon is the border between [[earth (planet)|]] and [[sky]]. As the horizon is usually obscured by trees, mountains, buildings, etc., it is most visible in settings dominated by the [[ocean]] or other featureless terrain.

When the outline of a city is visible over the horizon, this is known as a [[skyline]].

If the horizon is tilted with respect to the picture frame, the result is a [[dutch angle]].

h4. Examples

* !post #4297882

h4. See also

* [[mountainous horizon]]
* [[Tag group:Image Composition]]

title: drink_pouch
body:
A plastic and/or metal foil pouch used for beverages.  These pouches are fully-sealed, unlike a [[drink bag]], and feature either a spout or require a straw to puncture the pouch to drink the contents.

In the United States the drink brand [[Capri-Sun]] is noted for their aluminum-foil drink pouches.  In Asia there are a lot more types of drinks available in this packaging, such as jelly drinks.

title: puss_in_boots_(fairy_tale)
body: Puss in Boots is a European fairy tale from the 16th/17th century about an anthropomorphic cat who uses trickery and deceit to gain power, wealth, and the hand in marriage of a princess for his penniless and low-born master.

title: egypt
body:
A country located on the northeastern Africa, exactly at the end of the Nile river. Famous for its ancient culture.

On Danbooru, this tag applies to any post that features the overall landscape and cultural elements of Egypt, not just those of its ancient past, but also including the successor states after the fall of ancient Egypt as well. Do [b]NOT[/b] apply this tag simply because the post features [[Ancient Egyptian]] elements (ex. the character is wearing [[Ancient Egyptian clothes]]).

h4. Landmarks

* [[Ancient Egyptian architecture]]
** [[Abu Simbel]]
** [[Great Pyramid of Giza]]
** [[Sphinx of Giza]]
* [[Middle Eastern architecture]]

h4. See also

* [[Ancient Egyptian]]
** [[Ancient Egyptian clothes]]
** [[Egyptian art]]
** [[Egyptian mythology]]
** [[mummy]]
** [[pyramid (structure)|]]
* [[Egyptian flag]]

title: milk_bag
body:
A plastic bag that contains milk.  It is used as a packaging equivalent to [[milk carton]]s or plastic milk jug.  In places in Canada where milk is commonly sold bagged, the bags are used by putting them into a small [[pitcher (container)|]] sized for the bag and then the corner of the bag cut to allow for pouring.

Small milk bags were introduced into US schools in the late 80's and early 90's, but fell out of favor.  A common issue for kids was inserting the straw into the bag without spilling the milk.

h4. See also

* [[Drink bag]]

title: ambush
body:
An [b]ambush[/b] is a [[battle]] tactic where a character takes advantage of concealment or the [[surprised|element of surprise]] to [[attack]] unsuspecting characters from [[hiding|concealed]] positions, such as among dense underbrush or behind [[hill]]tops. Sometimes, an ambush can involve the exclusive or combined use of [[explosive|improvised explosive devices]], that allow the attacking characters to hit the targeted characters while minimizing the risk of being exposed to return fire.

In most [[tag group:role-playing games|RPG games]], an ambush will forbid all player actions, allowing the enemy to act first (example of indications: [[red theme|red swirl]] in [[mother (series)|MOTHER/EarthBound]], swapped positions in [[Final Fantasy]]).

h4. See also

* [[surprised]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ambush":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ambush]

title: michael_keaton
body:
Michael John Douglas (born September 5, 1951), known professionally as Michael Keaton, is an American actor.
Keaton gained early recognition for his comedic roles in Night Shift (1982), Mr. Mom (1983), and [[Beetlejuice]] (1988). He gained wider stardom portraying the title superhero in [[Batman (1989)]] and [[Batman Returns]] (1992). 

Keaton experienced a career resurgence after taking a starring role as a faded actor attempting a comeback in Alejandro González Iñárritu's Birdman (2014), for which he won a Golden Globe Award for Best Actor and a nomination for the Academy Award for Best Actor. He has since acted in biographical dramas such as Spotlight (2015), The Founder (2016), The Trial of the Chicago 7 (2020), and Worth (2021). He portrayed the [[vulture (marvel)|Vulture]] in [[Spider-Man: Homecoming]] (2017)  and [[Morbius (film)|Morbius]] (2022) while also reprising his roles as [[Batman]] in [[The Flash (movie)|]], and the title role in [[Beetlejuice Beetlejuice]] (2024).

title: the_flash_(movie)
body: The Flash is a 2023 American superhero film, it is the 13th installment in the [[DC Extended Universe]] (DCEU). In the film, [[Barry Allen|Barry]] travels back in time to prevent his mother's death, which brings unintended consequences.

title: the_suicide_squad_(2021_movie)
body:
2021 [[DC Comics]] movie directed by James Gunn. Based on a comic book series of the same name.
In the film, several convicts join a task force known as the "Suicide Squad" in exchange for lighter sentences. They are sent to the South American island nation of Corto Maltese to destroy all traces of the giant alien starfish Starro the Conqueror before it falls into the local government's control.

Not to be confused with [[Suicide Squad|the other similarly named movie]].

title: shendyt
body: A kilt-like garment [[ancient egyptian clothes|worn in Ancient Egypt.]] It was made of cloth and was worn around the waist, typically extending to above the knees. Shendyts are depicted on pharaohs, deities, and commoners in a variety of situations in Egyptian artwork.

title: nemes
body:
The nemes is the striped headcloth worn by [[pharaoh]]s in ancient Egypt. It covered the whole crown and back of the head and nape of the neck (sometimes also extending a little way down the back) and had lappets, two large flaps which hung down behind the ears and in front of both shoulders. - [i]from "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nemes [/i]

title: annet_myer
body:
Fictional female character and main protagonist of the 2D side-scrolling [[fantasy]] action [[video game]] [[El Viento]] released in 1991 for the [[Sega Mega Drive]].

[b]Annet Myer[/b] is a [[Peru]] [[Incan]] sorceress skilled with the use of bladed boomerangs and magical spells. Her name in Spanish (the actual language used in [[Peru]]) is more correctly spelled [b]Anita Mier[/b].

title: peru
body:
A country in the South American continent. 

It is a megadiverse country with habitats ranging from the arid plains of the Pacific coastal region in the west to the peaks of the Andes mountains extending from the north to the southeast of the country to the tropical Amazon Basin rainforest in the east with the Amazon river.

It was home to several ancient cultures. Ranging from the Norte Chico civilization starting in 3500 BCE, the oldest civilization in the Americas and one of the five cradles of civilization, to the Inca Empire.

Its official language is [[spanish_text|Spanish]] and Quechua.

h4.See also

* [[Peru]]
* [[Incan]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Peru":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peru

title: fad_assault_rifle
body:
The [b]FAD[/b], also known as [b]Dual Automatic Rifle[/b] (Spanish: [i][b]F[/b]usil [b]A[/b]utomático [b]D[/b]oble[/i]) is an advanced [[Peru]] automatic weapon designed in 2008 by Salomón Braga Lozo of [i]SIMA Electronica[/i], a division of the state owned SIMA (Spanish: [i]Servicio Industrial de la Marina[/i]) shipyards, based in the port of "Callao":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Callao , [[Peru]].

The FAD is a futuristic looking [[assault rifle]] centered around the NATO 5.56x45mm cartridge that offers low recoil, low weight and volume while at the same time giving precision, adequate range and ergonomy coupled with a "pump-action" type 40 mm grenade launcher in a single package. It is also a light "Bullpup" rifle that can easily be used as a back-up weapon by armored crews.

title: falke_(signalis)
body:
Replika Type FLKR (Führrungs Kommando Leiteinheit Replika | Operational Command Control Unit Replica) | Falke

The [[Falke_(Signalis) | Falke]] (Falcon in German.) is a character / unit in the game [[Signalis]]. 

Falke's are commander units meant to lead the security forces in the facilities in the Signalis universe, whether it be prison, mining, research or any other type of facility used by the Eusan Nation. They are typically perceived as godlike beings towards other Replika units, solidifying their status as commanders or leaders within their facilities.

In the game, the player encounters a comatose Falke during their playthrough.

Gameplay Spoilers :

[spoilers] Later in the game, the facility's Falke will awaken and you will need to fight them to continue the story. [/spoilers]

h6. Appearance
On top of being an [[android]], the Falke unit has in terms of notable visual traits, the following : [[Very long hair | Very long]], [[black_hair | black hair]], [[Blue_Eyes|blue eyes]], a half golden [[Laurel_Crown|laurel crown]] as a [[Hair_Ornament|hair ornament]] and [[forehead_mark | three marks]] on their forehead. 
Clothing wise, the Falke unit wears a black {{bodysuit}} with golden ornaments. Most notably golden rings on the leg and arm parts and the symbols on the right side of their torso.

title: x-men_film_series
body:
X-Men is an American superhero film series based on the [[Marvel]] Comics [[X-men|superhero team of the same name]]. [[20th_century_studios|20th Century Fox]] obtained the film rights to the team and other related characters in 1994 for $2.6 million. After numerous drafts, Bryan Singer was hired to direct the first film, released in 2000.

[[Deadpool & Wolverine]] (2024) integrates [[Deadpool]] from Fox's X-Men film series in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] and retains the R rating of the previous films, making it the first MCU film to have such a rating.

h4. Entries

[[Genshin Impact]] character. An apprentice and herb gatherer at Bubu Pharmacy.

"Blessed" by the adepti with a body that cannot die, this petite [[jiangshi]] cannot do anything without first giving herself orders to do it. Qiqi's memory is like a sieve. title: tre_kronor
body:
"Tre kronor" translates to "Three Crowns" and is Sweden's heraldic national symbol with a long history. It is used in the [[coat of arms]]/[[logo]] of many governmental branches.

It consists of three three-peaked crowns in an equilateral triangle, with two on top and one in the bottom. The most common shape of the insignia is that of a shield, but the air force uses a round version on their vehicles, in which case there is a border in the same colour as the crowns. In its base form, the crowns are yellow on a blue fill. On military vehicles colourless versions are often used, with black (or dark grey) crowns and border with no fill, which is used on bright surfaces, or a white fill with black or transparent crowns and no border, used on darker surfaces. Very old army vehicles can be seen in pictures and museums painted with a rectangular version of the insignia in the latter colour scheme. However, the rectangular insignia was eventually dropped in favour of painting the [[Swedish flag]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[Swedish air force]]
* [[Sweden]]
* [[Swedish uniform]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three_Crowns

title: swedish_air_force
body:
Use this tag for warplanes in Swedish service. Look for the Swedish insignia [[Tre Kronor]], which the air force uses a round version of that is either yellow with a blue fill or black with no fill.

Don't use this tag for warplanes that are of Swedish make, such as [[saab_gripen|Saab 39 Gripen]], but lack the Swedish air force insignia.

h4. See also

* [[Saab Draken]]
* [[Saab Gripen]]

title: wonder_festival
body:
A semiannual (February and August) event held in in Chiba, Japan. It is sponsored by the Kaiyodo manufacturing company. Its primary focus is to display and sell "garage kit" [[figure]]s of anime and game characters.

The expo has two [[Wonder Festival|mascot]] characters: [[Wanda (Wonder Festival)|]] and [[Reset (Wonder Festival)|]].

title: beidou_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

Captain of the Crux, with quite the reputation in Liyue. There are those who say she can split mountains and part the sea. Others say she draws lightning through her sword. Some say that even the mightiest of sea beasts are no match for her. For those not from Liyue, it may sound like a hearty joke, but those that have sailed with her will say— "No matter what sea beasts there may be, Beidou will be sure to split them all in two."

Her name is pronounced [b]Hokuto[/b] in the Japanese version of the game.

title: k9_(dog)
body:
A K9 or K-9 are specifically trained [[dog]]s to assist [[police|law enforcement]] and [[military]] personnel.  They're trained to assist in various duties, such as searching for drugs and explosives, locating missing or wounded people, finding crime scene evidence, protecting officers and other people, detecting enemy or intruders, and chasing and subduing fleeing suspects.

The breeds most commonly used by law enforcement and the military are the [[German Shepherd]], Belgian Malinois, Bloodhound, Dutch Shepherd, and [[Labrador Retriever]].  [[Rottweiler]] and Doberman Pinscher were also common breeds early on, but have since fallen out of favor.

h4. Examples

* !post #7263940: German Shepherd

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Police dog":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Police_dog]
* "Wikipedia: Attack dog":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attack_dog]

title: qingque_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]].

An average Diviner of the Divination Commission on the Xianzhou Luofu, and a librarian. She never slacks off when it comes to slacking off and is about to be demoted to a "door guardian." 

Fights using [[Mahjong tile]]s.

h4. Appearance
* !post #7690418: Splash art

h4. Profile
[expand]
An average Diviner of the Divination Commission, who will never slack off when it comes to slacking off.

She passed the Divination Commissions entrance exam to please her parents, only to discover what she had originally thought to be a relaxing public servant job to instead be very intensive and a worker's nightmare.

After several years of experience, Qingque had finally honed her craft — No matter which department she changes to, she remains the lowest level of Diviners.

"When there's nothing else left to do, why not bury your head in a book or play cards? What more could I ask for"
[/expand]

h4. See Also
* [[Qingque (Lucky Snack) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Ruan Mei's creations: Lucky Snack]]

title: konohanasakuya-hime_(mythology)
body:
(Konohana Sakuya-Hime, lit. Princess Blossoming Flower of the Tree)

A goddess in [[Japanese mythology]]. Her name was described as 木花之佐久夜毘売 (Konohana no Sakuya-Bime) in the "Kojiki.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kojiki 

She and her sister, Iwanaga-hime (Stone Longevity Princess) are the daughters of the mountain god Ohoyamatsumi. The mythology about them and "Ninigi-no-Mikoto":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ninigi-no-Mikoto is considered as a variation of "”the Stone and the Banana.”":http://www.mircea-eliade.com/from-primitives-to-zen/069.html Later she became associated with [[Mount Fuji]].

[[Konohana Sakuya (persona)|]], [[Amagi Yukiko]]'s persona in [[Persona 4]] was named after this goddess.

h4.See also

* Wikipedia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Konohanasakuya-hime

title: yunjian
body: A yunjian is an ornate [[Chinese clothes|traditional Chinese]] collar. It translates to cloud collar; its namesake derives from its dulating trim, of which is often cloud-like in design. It is sometimes also made to resemble feathers. The yunjian also often features [[print collar|elaborate print]] designs, and sometimes features several [[tassel]]s. The collar was popular during the [[ming_dynasty|Ming]] and [[qing_dynasty|Qing]] dynasties, and was mostly used during [[Chinese wedding|weddings]] and banquets. h4. Examples * !post #5396498 * !post #7401733 h4. External links "Wikipedia: Yunjian":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yunjian]

title: karenina:_ember_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Karenina (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], [[cyborg]] in appearance.

h4. Appearance
Ember frame of Karenina has [[orange eyes]] and [[white hair|white]]/[[blonde hair]]. Her hair style has [[twin drills]], [[swept bangs]] and [[sidelocks]] incorporated into the style, overall length is [[medium hair|medium]]. Features various [[hair ornament]]s, black diamonds on her bangs, [[mechabare|mechanical]] [[radio antenna]] is sometimes depicted as it is introduced by high awakening level of the frame. All four limbs are mechanical with [[robot joints|robotic (hinge) joints]], left [[mechanical arms]] connects just above the elbow while the right connects at the shoulder, both of her [[mechanical legs]] likely connects at her hips. Other notable components includes [[mechanical spine]] and mechanical [[breastplate]]. Has three black [[earclip]]s on her left ear.

Ember frame wears a [[two-tone dress|two tone]] [[backless dress]], made up a [[black dress|black]] [[reflective clothes|reflective]] fabric on the right laying over a [[white dress|white]] [[pleated dress|pleated]] patterned fabric on the left, featuring a [[see-through dress|see-through window]] of [[underboob cutout]], fitted with many [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] and [[orange ribbon|orange ribbon]]s.

She uses a [[cannon]] barrel as her weapon.

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[karenina: ember (deed of snow leopard) (pgr)|Deed of Snow Leopard]]
* [[karenina: ember (tulle redbud) (pgr)|Tulle Redbud]]
* [[karenina: ember (machina) (pgr)|Machina]]
* [[karenina: ember (bloody love) (pgr)|Bloody Love]]
* [[karenina: ember (gray feathers: ember) (pgr)|Gray Feathers: Ember]]
* [[karenina: ember (silver white) (pgr)|Silver White]]

h4. External links
* "GrayRavens wiki - Karenina: Ember Gallery":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Karenina:_Ember/Gallery]

title: watanabe:_astral_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Watanabe (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], [[cyborg]] in appearance.

h4. Appearance
An alternative frame for Watanabe, designed for piloting high altitude aircrafts, similar designs to a [[pilot suit]]. His Astral frame is mostly black and grey in coloration, has features such as a [[chest harness]], [[pouch]]/[[belt pouch]]es and [[mechabare]]. His [[medium hair|medium length]] [[grey hair]] is more naturally presented, his [[hair between eyes|bangs falls between his eyes]], covering his forehead barcode, and he has a short [[low ponytail]].

He has [[heterochromia]] eyes, [[blue eyes|blue left]] and [[yellow eyes|yellow right]], a [[bandaid on cheek|bandaid on right cheek]].

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[watanabe: astral (field training) (pgr)|Field Training]]
* [[watanabe: astral (skyline trial) (punishing: gray raven)|Skyline Trial]]
* [[watanabe: astral (captain hook) (pgr)|Captain Hook]]

h4. External links
* "GrayRavens wiki - Watanabe: Astral Gallery":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Watanabe:_Astral/Gallery]

title: nanami:_starfarer_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Nanami (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
Starfarer frame has [[grey eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] in a [[bob cut]] style on the front and a left [[side ponytail|side ponytail]], hair ornament is a black [[circlet]]. She wears a white and grey [[pilot suit]] with an [[backless outfit|backless design]], also featuring [[gold trim]] design and [[high heels|high heeled footwear]]. Some times depicted with gold [[tiara]] decorated with wings.

Her [[externally piloted mecha]] is named [[Power (pgr)|]].

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])

title: power_(pgr)
body:
[[nanami (pgr)|Nanami]]'s [[externally_piloted_mecha|externally piloted mecha]] used by her [[nanami: starfarer (pgr)|Starfarer]] frame.

Featuring shoulder rocket launch [[missile pod|pods]], [[pile bunker]] on the right arm and a foldable [[chainsword]] on the left.  In the [[nanami: starfarer (night navigator) (pgr)|Night Navigator]] skin, Power takes on a 21st century space vehicle theme akin to the ISS/NASA, but the mechanical parts function and bodily aspects remains the same.

He is also portrayed as more "cool" compared to the more nerdy and naive final version of Scott.

title: user_interface
body:
Posts depicting a [i]tangibly visible[/i] user interface, that is, a visual layout of various elements that a user might need in order to interact with software or some other technological product. Often features buttons, overlaid text, and/or a list or menu of choices. Older or more technically-oriented user interfaces may instead consist purely of text on a solid color background.

Most game screenshots or spoofs of the same ([[fake screenshot]]s inspired by games) will likely qualify for this tag. 

Avoid using this tag for physical input devices or other mechanical elements if there is no visible "UI screen", even if they might technically qualify as user interfaces (e.g. HID) in a formal sense.

h4. Music/video control

* [[Rewind button]] / [[Fast forward button]]

title: linux
body:
[b]Linux[/b] is a generic term referring to a family of Unix-like [[computer]] operating systems based on the [[GNU]] userland (or others) with the Linux kernel, i.e. GNU/Linux. [[Tux]] is its mascot, and serves as the logo for any distributions based off of the Linux kernel.

The Linux kernel is named after its creator, and current lead maintainer, [[Linus Torvalds]].

title: ultraman_cosmos_(eclipse_mode)
body:
[[Ultraman Cosmos]]'s super form, obtained in episode 30 of [[Ultraman Cosmos (series)|]].

This form was achieved after his defeat at the hands of Chaos Header and his revival under a lunar eclipse. This form represents the 'courage' of Musashi which revived Cosmos and combined the powers of Luna and Corona, making it more powerful than either form. It is the only form to require the presence of Musashi. Cosmos can only fight for roughly one minute in this form as it drains a lot of energy.

title: berserk
body:
An ongoing seinen dark fantasy action/horror manga series by [[Miura Kentarou]] that has been adapted into a 25-episode anime, a film trilogy, and summer 2016 TV anime series.

It follows the story of [[Guts (berserk)|]], the Black Swordsman, who wanders the earth fighting off demons that are drawn to the [[Brand of Sacrifice]] mark on his neck. Guts seeks revenge against [[Griffith (berserk)|]], his former best friend, whose betrayal led to the loss of Guts' hand and eye, and nearly everyone he cared about.

Miura passed away on May 6, 2021, leaving the series unfinished.  On June 7, 2022 it was announced that Miura's Studio Gaga under the supervision of Kouji Mori, a close friend of Miura, would resume the series utilizing material left behind or talked about by Miura before his passing.

title: fig_sign
body:
The Fig Sign is a hand gesture made with the hand and fingers curled into a fist and the thumb thrust between the middle and index fingers (or more rarely the middle and ring finger).  While not readily known in the US and many other English speaking countries, the same hand sign is used while playing the children's game I've Got Your Nose. 

The origin of the gesture is unknown and its meaning varies depending on where you are in the world.  In some places the gesture is used for good luck, particularly when used on small decorative hands carved into this gesture that are used as charms, in others, it's used as a mild version of the [[middle finger]] (such as in Russia, where it is called colloquially "кукиш/kukish" or "дуля/dulya", and is seen as a rude way to reject, deny, or dismiss someone).  The meaning of the gesture in the images on Danbooru will commonly mean something akin to "let's fuck."

h4. Examples

* !post #1609687

h4. See also

* [[penetration gesture]]
* [[Tag Group:Gestures]]

title: bossk
body:
Bossk'wassak'Cradossk, known more commonly as Bossk is a [[Star Wars]] character, he was a male Trandoshan bounty hunter and the son of Cradossk who was known for hunting Wookiees. During the Clone Wars, Bossk worked alongside fellow hunters Aurra Sing and Castas to mentor the orphaned [[Boba Fett]]. Their scheme to kill Fett's hated enemy, the Jedi Master [[Mace Windu]], resulted in Fett and Bossk's arrest. 
After the rise of the Empire, Bossk continued to be one of the biggest names in the bounty hunting business despite eventually drifting apart from Fett and working mostly solo. Bossk also took part in hunting Wookiees that were natural enemies of his species, particularly growing a distaste for the [[Wookiee]] [[Chewbacca]] and his partner, the human [[Han Solo]]. Despite just having finished a mission where his last surviving sibling, his sister Doshanalawook, made him swear to stop hunting Wookiees, Bossk was called upon by [[Darth Vader]] to find and capture Solo, Chewbacca, and their ship, the [[Millennium Falcon]].

title: tessa_(kipteitei)
body:

Her full name is Tessa Tienai. 
She’s a student at Amiya City Community College, where she meets [[saiya_(kipteitei)|Saiya Taiai]] and [[aika_(kipteitei)|Aika Eiai]].
In addition to being a student, she is also a popular streamer under the pseudonym “Tessakitz”.

She has [[long_hair|Long]] [[pink_hair|Pink Hair]], [[large_breasts|Large Breasts]], and typically wears a [[black_choker|Black Choker]].

title: aika_(kipteitei)
body:
Main Character from [[kipteitei|KipTeiTei’s]] comic “One Serving Choice”, and [[tessa_(kipteitei)|Tessa’s]] rival.

Her full name is Aika Eiai. 
She’s a student at Amiya City Community College, where she meets [[saiya_(kipteitei)|Saiya Taiai]] and [[tessa_(kipteitei)|Tessa Tienai]].

She has [[long_hair|Long]] [[blonde_hair|Blonde Hair]], [[large_breasts|Large Breasts]] and typically wears a [[black_hairband| Black Hairband]]

title: ghost_costume
body:
Any [[costume]] that resembles a [[ghost]]. 

This may consist of [[sheet ghost|a white sheet with eye holes cut out]], or a [[white cloak|white]] [[hooded cloak]]. 

In addition to this, Japanese media often depicts ghosts in Buddhist burial clothing, called shinishozoku. This often includes a simple [[white kimono]] with a collar folded right-over-left to denote death, as well as a white [[triangular headpiece]]. 

Characters might also be depicted alongside floating fire-shaped orbs called [[hitodama]]. The character might be also do a [[ghost pose]] by raising their hands and allowing their wrists to dangle loosely.

h4. Examples
* !post #6809891
* !post #7546914


h4. See also
* [[Halloween costume]]

title: rayman_limbs
body:
When a character's hands or feet float around them as opposed to being physically attached via arms or legs. [[Rayman]] is one of the most iconic characters with this trait, hence the tag's name.

The distinct [[chibi]] style of the [[jikkyou_powerful_pro_yakyuu|Power Pros]] series, and a number of [[Kirby_(series)|]] characters (such as [[Magolor]]) and [[pokemon|Pokémon]]'s [[Haunter]] also feature this limb style.

Please note that [[disembodied hand]] is for limbs without a body. It does not apply to Rayman limbs.

title: absolute_cinema_(meme)
body:
An [[image macro (meme)|]] [[meme]] that involves a [[greyscale]] photo of film director Martin Scorsese raising his hands captioned with the catchphrase.

Used to positively comment on dramatic events in sports matches, as well as on films, shows and video games that one considers to be of high quality.

title: crypto.com_arena
body: Formerly known as the [b]Staples Center[/b], the Crypto.com Arena is an indoor sports arena and multi-purpose venue in downtown [[Los Angeles]], California, USA. It is currently home to the [[Los Angeles Lakers]] of the [[National Basketball Association]] and the [[Los Angeles Kings]] of the [[National Hockey League]].

title: guimpe
body:
Pronounced 'gyump' - an article of clothing, typically comprised of a [[white collar]] that coveres the neck and shoulders of the wearer, and sometimes the entire chest as well. 

Historically worn by women to represent social standing and modesty. Most often depicted on [[nun]]s.

h4. See also
* [[Puritan collar]]
* [[Wimple]]

title: wimple
body:
A type of headwear that typically covers the head in a similar fashion to a [[detached hood]] - that is, wound snugly around the head, leaving the face bare, but covering the jaw and ears. When worn in this fashion, it is also referred to as a barbette. 

Derived from [[medieval]] times, the wimple is most often seen in depictions of [[traditional nun]]s, where it is worn under a [[veil]], and often attached to a [[guimpe]] - this is a collar, usually white, that covers the shoulders.

h4. Examples
* !post #7578778
* !post #350904
* !post #726
* !post #5629713: A wimple styled into a '[i]cornette[/i]'

title: neil_nordegraf
body:
[[Scott Pilgrim (series)|]] character. More commonly known by his nickname Young Neil. A backup member of Sex Bomb-omb and [[Stephen Stills]]'s roommate. Looks strikingly similar to [[scott pilgrim|Scott]].

In the [[scott pilgrim takes off|anime]], he ends up "writing" a movie about Scott's life. In actuality, the script just showed up one day, and Neil believes he wrote it.

[b]CV:[/b] Johnny Simmons (EN), Kawasaki Yuto (JPN)

title: sen_to_chihiro_no_kamikakushi
body:
A 2001 Japanese animated [[fantasy]] film written and directed by [[miyazaki_hayao_(person)|Miyazaki Hayao]] and produced by [[Studio Ghibli]]. 

Known in America simply as [b]Spirited Away[/b], this movie is about a a shy and timid girl, [[ogino chihiro|Chihiro]], whose family is moving. In the process they visit an abandoned theme park, which turns out to be the entrance to the spirit world. Trapped there, she gets a job at the local bath house, where she learns about the magnificent world of spirits. She is guided by a mysterious boy named [[Haku (sen to chihiro no kamikakushi)|]] as she tries to make her way home.

It garnered the [[the academy awards|Oscar]] for Best Animated Feature in 2003, the first anime movie to win an Oscar.

h4. Characters

title: cel_rendering
body: A technique found in [[3D]] media that mimics the appearance of 2D illustrations. A well-known example is [[The Legend of Zelda]]'s [[the_legend_of_zelda:_breath_of_the_wild|Breath of the Wild]]. In 3D media, cel rendering is typically employed by use of minimalist textures and shaders. This may include hard-edged shadows and highlights, sometimes to a degree that causes visual [[color banding]], and other times, there may be [[flat color|an intentional omission of shadows]] altogether (e.g. [[Untitled Goose Game]]). There may also be use of a prominent outline ([[ookami_(game)|Okami]]), and on the flipside, there may be an [[no lineart|omission of an outline]] altogether. For the 2D cel shading technique, see [[anime coloring]] instead. h4. Media examples Anime * [[ajin_(sakurai_gamon)|Ajin]] * [[BanG Dream!]] * [[Trigun Stampede]] Videogames * [[Jet Set Radio]] * [[shin_subarashiki_kono_sekai|NEO: The World Ends With You]] * [[Ni no Kuni]] * [[The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker]] h4. See also * [[Low poly]]
other_names: トゥーンシェーディング

title: duo_(mega_man)
body: Character from the [[Mega Man (classic)|original]] [[Mega Man (series)|]] series. An extraterrestrial robot with the mission to eliminate the Evil Energy. His left hand glows to absorb and destroy the Evil Energy.

title: sea_turtle
body: An almost entirely aquatic strain of [[turtle]]s that live in the [[sea]]. Their front legs are adapted for life in the water, taking the form of large flippers.

title: alphonse_(av-98_ingram)
body:
A fictional [[police]] giant robot from the [[Kidou Keisatsu Patlabor]] anime and manga series.

This [[AV-98 Ingram]] is the [[mecha]] of choice for officer [[Izumi Noa]]. She named her unit [b]"Alphonse"[/b], a name previously held by a [[pet]] [[dog]] and a pet [[cat]], respectively.

It has a number 1 [[roundel]] in its left shoulder.

title: osana_najimi_(komi-san_wa_komyushou_desu)
body:
A character in [[Komi-san wa Komyushou desu]]. [b]Osana Najimi[/b], a person of [[androgynous|indeterminable gender]] at [[Komi Shouko]]'s high school. Is childhood friends with EVERY student at said school except for Komi herself. Has alternated expressed gender every school year.

They have [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]] stylized with bangs & [[antenna hair]]. Their [[school uniform]] consists of a [[open jacket|open]] [[blue jacket|blue]] [[blazer]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[striped necktie]], [[diagonal-striped skirt|diagonal-striped]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[loafers]].

h4. External links

* "Komi-san Wiki: Osana Najimi":https://komisan.fandom.com/wiki/Najimi_Osana

He has [[brown eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blunt ends|blunt]] hair, depicted as either [[red hair|red]] or [[pink hair|pink]].

His default outfit includes a [[short-sleeved jacket|short-sleeved]] [[red jacket]], [[red gloves]], [[black pants]] and [[red footwear|red]] [[shoes]].

title: monica_blanchflower
body:
モニカ・ブランチフラワー (Monica Blanchflower)

A leading character from "World Crusher", one of [[Mochimako (mushikera Hoi2)|]]'s [[original]] universe/story. 

She was born in Britain and raised in Japan. Although she is a 17 year old third-year high school student, she has smoking habit. She likes [[brand_name_imitation|Madnald]]'s cheeseburger and hates her nickname, "Running [[Rabbit|Bunny]]." She has a close friend, [[Akai Ringo (mochimako)|]] and a brother, [[finn blanchflower|Finn]]. She is a "Transer", who has an ability that can transfer herself from "Trans World" (our earth) to a fantasy world called "Cis world." She and her work-buddy, [[wolger wolfman|Wolger]], who is another main character of this story, are members of "Central Corps."

title: starship_troopers
body:
[i][b]Starship Troopers[/b][/i] is an [[united states|American]] military [[science fiction|science fiction]] novel by "Robert A. Heinlein":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_A._Heinlein , first published (in abridged form) as a serial in [i]The Magazine of Fantasy & Science Fiction[/i] (October, November 1959, as "Starship Soldier") and published hardcover in December, 1959.

The first-person narrative is about a young human soldier of [[philippines|Filipino]] ethnicity named [[johnny_rico|Juan "Johnnie" Rico]] and his exploits in the [[Mobile Infantry]], a futuristic [[military]] unit of [[space marine]]s  equipped with [[power armor]]s and involved in an interstellar war between mankind and an [[arachnid_(starship_troopers)|arachnid]] [[alien]] species known as "the [[Bug]]s".

This book is notable because it was one of the first works of science fiction that introduced the concept of [[power suit]]s. It influenced many sci-fi anime creators and helped to create the [b]Real Robot[/b] genre of piloted [[mecha]] (The creators of [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979 have cited Starship Troopers as an important inspiration).

In 1988, Sunrise and Bandai Visual produced a 6 episode Japanese OVA adaptation locally titled [[Uchuu No Senshi]].

The most famous and well known adaptation of the book is the 1997 movie adaptation directed by Paul Verhoeven and staring Casper Van Dien, Denise Richards and Neil Patrick Harris. The movie has a mixed reception since some criticized Verhoeven as he never fully read the book and thought the books themes of militarism and patriotism was more like Fascism and portray the human government in the book as Fascists while other praises the movie as a satire of Nationalism and Military Propaganda.

h4. See also

* [[Carmen Ibanez]]
* [[Dizzy Flores]]
other_names: スターシップ・トゥルーパーズ

title: crux_(constellation)
body:
Crux (the [[Cross]], commonly known as the [i]Southern Cross[/i]) is a [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere. It is the smallest yet one of the most distinguishable constellations. Its brightest star is Acrux.

Crux is an easily recognizable constellation. Its 4 bright stars form a Latin cross '✝' with a slightly tilted horizontal line and a red star on top. It technically has a fifth star that is not connected to the main cross pattern. The constellation lies directly between the "legs" of [[Centaurus (constellation)|]] (the Centaur).

The prominent features of Crux, along with the brightest stars of Centaurus, serve as pointers to the South Celestial Pole. The constellation appears on the flags of [[australian flag|Australia]], [[brazilian flag|Brazil]], [[new zealand flag|New Zealand]], [[papua new guinean flag|Papua New Guinea]] and [[samoan flag|Samoa]].

h4. Examples
* !asset #23246616
* !asset #23245840: Crux and Centaurus
* !post #1676940

h4. Neighboring  constellations
* [[Centaurus (constellation)|]]
* Musca

h4. External links
* "eSky: Crux":https://www.glyphweb.com/esky/constellations/crux.html

body:

Often they are called to provide containment or potentially pacify violence.

Commonly depicted with black armor, transparent [[riot shield]]s, and [[face shield|visored]] [[helmet]]s.

title: giant_penguin
body:
Palaeeudyptinae, the giant penguins, are an extinct subfamily of [[penguin|penguins]] known to have existed from the mid-Eocene into the late Oligocene and possibly into the Miocene. Some of its members, such as [[Anthropornis]] and Pachydyptes, are some of the largest penguin species ever known.

title: sagittarius_(constellation)

Sagittarius (the Archer) is a [[zodiac]] [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere, between [[Scorpius (constellation)|]] to the west and [[Capricorn (constellation)|Capricornus]] to the east. Its brightest star is Kaus Australis.

Sagittarius has the rough appearance of a stick-figure centaur archer drawing a bow. The brightest stars of the constellation form an asterism known as the [i]Teapot[/i].

title: centaurus_(constellation)
body:
Centaurus (the [[Centaur]]) is a [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere. Its brightest stars are [i]Alpha[/i] and [i]Beta Centauri[/i].

Centaurus, along with [[Sagittarius (constellation)|]], another centaur-associated constellation, has the rough appearance of a stick-figure centaur. Directly to its left lies [[Lupus (constellation)|]] (the Wolf), often interpreted as an animal that has been killed or is about to be killed by the Centaur. And between its "legs" lies [[Crux (constellation)|]], commonly known as the Southern Cross. 

The brightest stars of Centaurus, along with the prominent features of Crux, serve as pointers to the South Celestial Pole.

In the photograph, Reynolds looks upset and the other two are laughing at him. Reynolds captioned the photograph, "These fucking assholes said it was a sweater party." The post received more than 8.1 million likes in four days.

title: piscis_austrinus_(constellation)
body:
Piscis Austrinus (the Southern [[Fish]]) is a [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere. It was formerly known as Piscis Notius. Its brightest star is Fomalhaut (lit. "mouth of the fish").

Piscis Austrinus is sometimes depicted as being directly connected to [[Aquarius (constellation)|]] (the Water-Bearer) by Fomalhaut, although this star belongs exclusively to Piscis Austrinus. The connection symbolizes the pouring of water from Aquarius into the mouth of the Southern Fish. The constellation used to have a tail running southward, which was later separated into the constellation of [[Grus (constellation)|]] (the Crane).

h4. Examples

title: emperor_penguin
body:
A species of [[penguin]] native to [[Antarctica]]. The tallest and largest of all penguin species. Adults are recognizable by the yellowish feathers around their ears and neck. [[baby penguin|Chicks]] are recognizable by their grey feathers and black heads with white faces.

They can very easily be confused with [[king penguin|king penguins]], however, emperor penguins are significantly taller and the colors around their ears and necks are different.

* !asset #22894021

h4. See also

* [[Emperor Penguin (Kemono Friends)]]

h4. External links

* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emperor_penguin

title: afterglow
body:
As in "basking in the afterglow" - the warm, glowing feeling of bliss that lingers following [[orgasm]] after engaging in [[happy sex]]. 

For this tag to apply, it should be clear that the affection hasn't really finished, but the physical activity is merely winding down. The persons involved should still emotionally focused on each other, doing things like [[cuddling]], [[spooning]], [[holding hands]], making [[eye contact]], and similar indications of affection, possibly also (literally) [[sleeping]] together through the night. If the partners have disengaged from one another, then the "encounter" really is over, and this tag should not be used.

Contrasted with [[after sex]], which indicates graphic, physical evidence of prior sex, use of [[afterglow]] should be based on the apparent emotional state of those involved. Also note that, while they can coexist, these two tags tend to be mutually exclusive due to reasons of conflicting mood and style.

For the group from [[BanG Dream!]], refer to [[Afterglow (BanG Dream!)]].

H4. See also

* [[couple]]
* [[foreplay]] for similarly passionate gestures and actions before sex

title: aquarius_(constellation)
body:
Aquarius (the Water Bearer) is a [[zodiac]] [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere, between [[Capricorn (constellation)|Capricornus]] to the west and [[Pisces (constellation)|]] to the east. Aquarius is the second largest zodiac constellation after Virgo. Its brightest star is Sadalsuud.

Aquarius is sometimes depicted as being directly connected to [[Piscis Austrinus (constellation)|]] (the Southern Fish) by Fomalhaut, although this star belongs exclusively to Piscis Austrinus. The connection symbolizes the pouring of water from Aquarius into the mouth of the Southern Fish. The Y-shaped star pattern at the top of the constellation forms an asterism called the "Water Jar".

h4. Examples
* !asset #23245242: Aquarius connecting to Fomalhaut
* !asset #23245244
* !asset #23245246
* !asset #23245245
* !asset #23245261: Aquarius and Piscis Austrinus

h4. Neighboring constellations
* [[Aquila (constellation)|]]
* [[Capricorn (constellation)|Capricornus]]
* [[Cetus (constellation)|]]
* [[Delphinus (constellation)|]]
* [[Equuleus (constellation)|]]
* [[Pegasus (constellation)|]]
* [[Pisces (constellation)|]]
* [[Piscis Austrinus (constellation)|]]
* Sculptor

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Aquarius":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aquarius_(constellation)

* "eSky: The Water Jar":https://www.glyphweb.com/esky/constellations/waterjar.html

title: scott_pilgrim_takes_off
body:
[i]Scott Pilgrim Takes Off[/i] is an animated adaptation of the [[Scott Pilgrim (series)|]] comic book series by Bryan Lee O'Malley, the second after Titmouse's [i]Scott Pilgrim vs. the Animation[/i] in 2010. The anime was produced by [[Science SARU]] and released on Netflix in November 2023.

It is not actually a retelling of the series; it begins as a straightforward adaptation, but quickly goes into its own plot starring [[Ramona Flowers]].

* "Wikipedia: Scott Pilgrim Takes Off":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scott_Pilgrim_Takes_Off

title: anthropornis
body:
Anthropornis ("man bird") is an extinct genus of giant [[penguin]] ([[giant penguin|Palaeeudyptinae]]) that existed from around the Lutetian stage of the Eocene epoch to the Rupelian stage of the Oligocene. Described from fossils found in the La Meseta Formation on Seymour Island off the [[Antarctica|Antarctic]] coast, they are some of the largest penguins ever known, having reached heights of up to 1.8 metres. The genus comprises two species:

* Anthropornis nordenskjoldi
* Anthropornis grandis

title: millipede
body:
A flattened arthropod with a long, segmented body. Millipedes usually feed on dead or decaying plant matter. Millipedes have a pair of legs on their second through fourth body segments, and two pairs of legs on most following segments. Millipedes defend themselves from attack by coiling up to protect their bodies with their exoskeleton, and by using chemical defenses.

title: chinook_(splatoon)
body:
A type of non-confrontational [[salmonid]] of [[Splatoon (series)|]]'s [[Salmon Run (splatoon)|]]. They accompany the [[Mothership (splatoon)|]] boss during an event-specific wave. They traverses the area in repurposed [[octocopter]] helmets while carrying ice-boxes. These boxes are the main source for [[Golden Egg]] drops if splatted by the freelancer.

If these boxes are not splatted they erupt and revealed to be carriers of lesser salmonids such as [[smallfry (splatoon)|]]s, [[chum (splatoon)|]]s, and [[cohock (splatoon)|]]s.

title: udu_(instrument)
body: The kim-kim or Udu is a plosive aerophone (in this case implosive) and an idiophone of the Igbo of Nigeria. In the Igbo language, ùdù means 'vessel' or 'pot'. This is a hand percussion instrument and it is one of the most important instruments in Igbo music.

title: morin_khuur
body: The morin khuur (Mongolian: морин хуур) also known as the horsehead fiddle, is a traditional Mongolian bowed stringed instrument. It is one of the most important musical instruments of the [[mongolia|Mongol]] people, and is considered a symbol of the nation of Mongolia.

title: race_queen
body:
A model usually present at auto racing events. They are typically seen wearing skimpy outfits bearing the logos of the racing team and/or its sponsors. Their official job is to hold a [[parasol]] over the driver to shield them from sunlight while their car is being worked on. Also known as a [i]grid girl[/i] or [i]umbrella girl[/i].

The term [i]race queen[/i] can be used interchangeably with the terms [i]campaign girl[/i] and [i][[booth babe]][/i] as all refer to models in skimpy outfits. Campaign girls can be seen more in trade shows and the like, specially those that market [[motor vehicle]]s, while booth babes are seen in smaller booths, especially acting as booth tenders or helpers.

Due to the increased presence of women in motorsports and safety concerns regarding their outfits in pit lanes, race queens have been phased out of almost all major motorsport series, with [[Super GT]], [[Moto GP]], and [[Deutsche Tourenwagen Masters]] being notable holdouts - DTM even offering the option for male pit models to accompany female drivers.

The most recognizable form of race queen outfit is a revealing outfit usually consisting of a [[crop top]] or [[tube top]] with a [[skirt]] or [[shorts]], designed to highlight the model's [[midriff]] and legs, although [[highleg leotard]]s and [[highleg_one-piece_swimsuit|swimsuits]] with or without additional accessories have also been common as outfits especially during the 1990s in Japan. Recently, race queens in less revealing outfits have also become more common, primarily in regions outside of Japan that still employ them - their outfits will usually consist of form-fitting [[dress]]es or [[bodysuit]]s instead. 

h4. Examples
* !post #97431: A typical race queen outfit
* !post #2246767: Racing PIAA race queen wearing a white leotard/one-piece swimsuit with sash
* !post #3122297: [[Pacific Racing Team]]'s 2015 race queen outfit
* !post #6638123: [[Racing Project Bandoh]]'s 2024 race queen outfit with a [[bodystocking]]
* !asset #21090138: [[Sawa Sumire]], a [[real life]] race queen in [[Autobacs Racing Team Aguri]]'s 2022 outfit

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Race queen":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Race_queen

body:
A type of [[gun]] mechanism by which the shooter has to manually cycle the action to chamber a new [[cartridge|round]] for each time they need to shoot, by [b]directly moving the bolt[/b] via a [b]bolt handle[/b] (also known as a cocking handle). The earliest example of bolt-action gun that is fielded by an military is the Prussian [[Dreyse needle gun]]
