title: fullmetal_alchemist
body:
[b]Fullmetal Alchemist[/b] ([i]Hagane no Renkinjutsushi[/i]) is a Japanese [[Steampunk]] manga series written and illustrated by [[Arakawa Hiromu]], with two anime adaptations made by Bones studio.

After a failed attempt to resurrect their dead mother via alchemy, [[Edward Elric]] lost his left leg, while his younger brother [[Alphonse Elric|Alphonse]] lost his entire body, forcing the former to sacrifice his right arm to affix Alphonse's soul into a suit of armor. After gaining [[automail]] prosthetics from childhood friend and mechanic [[Winry Rockbell]], Edward enlists into the Amestris State Military to seek the Philosopher's Stone, hoping to restore their bodies, unaware of its secrets.

body:
One of the playable Valkyria [[official alternate costume|outfits]] of [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]'s [[Kiana Kaslana]]. 

The base Void Drifter outfit consists of a [[black dress]] with a white breast-side top, [[white belt]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves|elbow glove]] on her right arm, [[white gloves|white glove]] on her left hand, [[black jacket|black]] [[cropped jacket]] worn [[jacket on shoulders|on her shoulders]], [[single thighhigh|single]] [[black thighhighs|black thighhigh]] on her right leg, [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]], and an orange spiked [[hair ornament]] on her left side. 

She has one variant of the outfit, named "Radiant Blaze".

title: katsuragi_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Katsuragi[/i], introduced in the April 2015 event. 
Character design by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Kayano Ai]].

She is portrayed with [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[white ribbon|white]] [[hair ribbon]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[flat chest]]. Her base outfit consists of a green [[furisode]] with orange [[camouflage]] patterns, [[green sash|green]] [[obi]] with her real-life flight deck camouflage pattern, [[white shirt]] top, [[muneate]] patterned off her real-life bow, white [[fundoshi]], and [[green footwear|green]] [[platform footwear]]. 

In her kai form, she disposes of the kimono entirely, and wears a [[pleated skirt]], [[uneven gloves|asymmetric]] [[fingerless gloves]], with one being [[elbow_gloves|an elbow glove]], and [[black thighhighs]] to create [[zettai ryouiki]]. 

She is a huge admirer of [[Zuikaku (kancolle)|]] and frequently calls her senpai. At the time of Katsuragi's completion, Zuikaku was the only remaining standard aircraft carrier in the IJN apart from the Unryuu-class. 

h4. Skins

* !post #1996997: Base
* !post #1997016: [[Katsuragi Kai (kancolle)|]]

h4. [i]Unryuu[/i]-class aircraft carriers
* [[Unryuu (Kancolle)|]]
* [[Amagi (Kancolle)|]]
* [b]Katsuragi[/b]

* [[Katsuragi (Azur Lane)]]

* "Kantai Collection Wiki: Katsuragi":[http://kancolle.wikia.com/wiki/Katsuragi]

title: hush_(the_binding_of_isaac)
body: One of many superbosses in [[The Binding of Isaac]]. Unlocked by defeating Mom's Heart at least 10 times, he can only be accessed by defeating said Heart (or It Lives!) within 30 minutes of the current run. What follows is not just a fight with [[???_(the_binding_of_isaac)|???]], but also a hidden second phase where he grows into a [[kaiju]] and fights [[isaac_(the_binding_of_isaac)|Isaac]] with [[danmaku]] and various hordes of monsters.

title: venti_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable Anemo character in [[Genshin Impact]].

A [[bard]] that seems to have arrived on some unknown wind — sometimes sings songs as old as the hills, and other times sings poems fresh and new.

His true identity is the human form of the Anemo Archon [[Barbatos (genshin impact)|]]. His [[Vision (genshin impact)|]] is just a glass ball he carries around to alleviate suspicion.

He has a similar appearance to the [[Nameless Bard (genshin impact)|]], whose guise he took after becoming the Anemo Archon, as well as to [[Wendy (Honkai Impact)|]] from [[Honkai Impact 3rd]].

His signature weapon is [[Elegy of the End (Genshin Impact)|Elegy of the End]].

h4. Appearance

He has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with [[twin braids]]. In his default outfit he wears a [[green hat|green]] [[beret]], [[green cape|cape]], and [[green shorts|shorts]], with [[white pantyhose]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]]. He carries a [[lyre]].

In his [[Venti (Archon) (Genshin Impact)|Archon]] form he wears a very revealing [[midriff]]-exposing [[crop top]] and a [[hooded capelet]]. He also wears elbow-length [[bridal gauntlets]], along with [[short shorts]] and a [[single thighhigh]]. The outfit is overall predominantly white. He also has white [[feathered wings]].

h4. Official art

title: sucrose_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

An alchemist from Mondstadt who is actually very good at preserving and encouraging the growth of living things (in a non-threatening way), she's painfully shy around other people but is quite gung-ho about her research. A classic shy science-type.

She has hard-to-see [[animal ears]], which are most likely [[cat ears]] (see "Sucrose's Story 2":[https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Sucrose/Story#Story_2]) or [[fox ears]] (see [[Yae Miko]]). 

She is named 砂糖 (Shātáng, literally meaning "granulated sugar") in the Chinese script, and thus is tagged like that on Pixiv oftentimes.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4128554: Splash art
* !post #5615794: [[Sucrose (Sweets Paradise) (Genshin Impact)|Sweets Paradise collaboration]]

title: rosaria_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable [[Genshin Impact]] character.

Rosaria is a sister in Mondstadt's Church of Favonius. Despite her position, she often procrastinates her work. She hails from a "family" of bandits in which the church promotes her as a secret purveyor of justice in order to eliminate potential threats on Mondstadt. She first appeared in [i]Princeps Cretaceus[/i] Story Quest as an NPC, then became playable following the [i]Windblume Festival[/i] event from the Version 1.4 update.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4469050: Splash art

title: noelle_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

Like most of Mondstadt's young people, Noelle always dreamed of being a knight of Favonius when she grew up. She may not have what it takes to be a knight just yet, but she is learning. Working as a [[maid]] at the Knights' headquarters, she is constantly taking notes on what constitutes knightly speech, knightly conduct, and knightly customs. She holds firm to her belief that one day she will join their ranks — she just needs to keep trying her hardest at everything she does.

h4. Appearance

title: lisa_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable Electro character in [[Genshin Impact]].

She is an intellectual [[witch]] who can never get enough naps. As the Librarian of the Knights of Favonius, Lisa is smart in that she always knows exactly what to do with whatever troubles her. As much as she loves her sleep, she still manages to keep everything under control in a calm, composed manner.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]], [[green eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. She wears purple clothes, a large [[purple hat|purple]] [[witch hat]], and [[black thighhighs]].

title: eula_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable Cryo character in [[Genshin Impact]].

She is the captain of the Knights of Favonius' Reconnaissance Company and a descendant of the Lawrence Clan, a prominent family in Mondstadt infamous for its tyrannical reign before it was overthrown in an uprising led by the Dandelion Knight. 

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium]]-length [[blue hair]]. In her default outfit she wears [[thigh boots]] with blue, black and white clothes. She wields the [[sword]] [[Song of Broken Pines (Genshin Impact)|]].

title: jean_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

As the Acting Grand Master of the Knights, Jean has always been devoted to her duties and maintaining peace in Mondstadt. She had taken precautions long before the onset of Stormterror's assault, and she will guard Mondstadt with her life as always.

Her younger sister, [[Barbara (Genshin Impact)|Barbara]] is a deaconess for the Church of Favonius.

title: bennett_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

A young adventurer of the Mondstadt Adventurers' Guild who seems to always find himself tangled up in baffling bouts of bad luck. He is the only active member of his own adventure group, known as "Benny's Adventure Team," after all the other members decided to "take leave" following a series of unfortunate incidents. As a result, the team is currently on the verge of being dissolved. Unable to break the poor boy's heart, Katheryne of the Adventurers' Guild has kept "Benny's Adventure Team" on the books, whilst also hiding from him the fact that all the other members have long since officially left the team.

h4. Appearance

title: long-necked_rhino_(genshin_impact)
body:
A creature in [[Genshin Impact]].

A massive beast that lives in Natlan, though it is not a Saurian. Long-Necked Rhinos are primarily blue and orange with a white underside. They have namesake long necks akin to the neck of a giraffe or brontosaurus, walk on four legs, and have a single horn on their heads.

body:

h4. Appearance
Garnet also features [[very long hair|very long]] [[red hair]], but is tied in a single [[high ponytail]], decorated with two [[black hairband]]s (the frontal band creates a pair of [[hair intakes]], the second band is placed further up top), [[hair between eyes|bangs between eyes]], long [[sidelocks]], and [[red eyes]] with a single [[mole under eye|mole under her left eye]].

Apparels are typically shown as wearing a skin-tight [[white bodysuit]] and a [[short sleeves|short sleeved]] [[jacket]], a pair of black [[thigh boots|thigh high boots]]. Depending on awakening level, she can be depicted with a [[black bodysuit]] and exposed thighs forming [[zettai ryouiki]]. The [b]Chi Rho[/b] (☧) is a symbol composed of the Greek letters Χ (chi) and Ρ (rho), the two first letters of the name of [[jesus|Jesus Christ]] in Greek (ΧΡΙΣΤΟΣ). It was employed by early Christians to also symbolize [[Christianity]]. It is also called [b]Chrismon[/b].

title: kikka_(airplane)
body:
The [b]Nakajima Kikka[/b], sometimes known by its misattributed designation J9N or J9Y, was a jet fighter build for the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] during the later stage of [[World War II]]. It was the first jet fighter ever built by Japan.

Although it bears a strong resemblance to the German [[Me 262]], the plane is not directly related. Only two prototypes were completed before the war's end, thus the plane never entered service. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #8107625

h4.See Also
* [[Ki-201 Karyuu]] - IJA's more direct derivative of the Me 262
* [[list of airplanes]]

h4.External Links
* "Wikipedia: Nakajima Kikka":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nakajima_Kikka

title: n1k
body:
A late-war [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] aircraft.
Can refer to the original N1K [i]Kyoufuu[/i] seaplane fighter or the later N1K1-J/N1k2-J [i]Shiden[/i] land fighter.

h4. [i]Kyoufuu[/i]
As originally designed by Kawanishi Aircraft (post-war ShinMaywa), it was a single-float seaplane fighter meant to be used from shore bases that didn't have airfields for proper fighters. By the time the N1K entered service, its role was no longer necessary or appropriate.

h4. [i]Shiden[/i] (and [i]Shiden-kai[/i])

Kawanishi saw the potential of the N1K as a true fighter and pursued it as a private company venture, entering service in early 1944 as one of the few aircraft that allowed the Japanese to face off against late-war Allied fighters. Nevertheless, it was produced too late and in not enough numbers for the Japanese to turn the tide of the war.

h4. Appearance

* !post #5280964: Kyoufuu (N1K)
* !post #1782944: Shiden (N1K1)

A carrier-based variant (N1K3-A Shiden KAI 2) was produced but there was no need for them at a time when the IJN ran short of carrier-qualified pilots.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Kawanishi N1K":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kawanishi_N1K]

title: kawanishi_e15k
body:
The [b]Kawanishi E15K[/b] was a reconnaissance [[seaplane]] developed in the early 1940s for the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]]. 

The E15K was designed to equip the [i]Ooyodo[/i]-class light cruisers, which were originally envisioned as flagships for submarine flotillas, with long-range aerial reconnaissance capabilities. The aircraft was built for speed, with retractable stabilizing floats in the wings and the ability to jettison the central main float in an emergency, but neither the retractable floats nor the main float jettison system worked reliably in practice. The aircraft also suffered from significant mechanical unreliability and high maintenance needs.

Ultimately, the planned use of the [i]Ooyodo[/i] class was abandoned and the [[Ooyodo (Kancolle)|single completed ship of the class]] was refitted as a command cruiser for surface formations instead.  Only 15 E15Ks were produced, and none was ever carried by [[Ooyodo (Kancolle)|Ooyodo]].  Even so, some [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i] fan artists depict her with them instead of the [[Aichi E13A]] scout seaplanes she actually carried.

Called [b][i]Shiun[/i][/b] ("Violet Cloud")  by the Japanese, the E15K had the Allied reporting name [b]Norm[/b]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #8115304

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Kawanishi E15K":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kawanishi_E15K]

title: acuo
body:
Mint chewing gum by [[Lotte (company)|]].

Posts with this tag reference the gum's "Boutique" commercial, wherein Ikuta Toma's breath magically turns a store clerk into [[Asahina Mikuru]], the store manager into [[Suzumiya Haruhi]], and a trio of stray cats into a group of [[cat ears|cat-eared]] [[Nagato Yuki]].

30 second version transcript:
Clerk 1: "I'm sorry, we're all out."
Customer: "Oh, I see." *sighs*
Clerk 1: *inhales*
*poof*
Mikuru: "What wonderful breath."
Clerk 2: "Hey mister, you're causing trouble!  Do you think it's okay to go around turning people into anime characters?"
Customer: "Sorry!"
Clerk 2: *inhales*
*poof*
Haruhi: "Hey, that's really great!"
Customer: *runs outside panting*
Cats: "..."
*poof*
Nagatos: "Nya~n."
Announcer: "Gum designed for fresh breath.  Lotte.  Acuo."

h4. External links
* "Youtube: ACUO Haruhi CM 30s":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DgS9vWSWnrs
* "Youtube: Acuo Haruhi CM 15s Ver":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6DTB9hmvxmM

title: absinthe
body:
A highly [[alcohol]]ic anise-flavored spirit derived from various culinary herbs such as grand wormwood, green anise, sweet fennel, and others.   Traditionally it has a green color, though it may also be colorless. 

It is normally diluted with cold water and sweetened before drinking, due to its strong and bitter taste, and sometimes served with an [[absinthe spoon]].

In classical literature the drink is commonly referred to as "la fée verte" (the green fairy).

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Absinthe":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Absinthe

title: nino_(winter)_(fire_emblem)
body:
Tag used for [[Nino (Fire Emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem]], specifically when dressed in her winter attire from the [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] 2019 "Glorious Gifts":[https://feheroes.fandom.com/wiki/Glorious_Gifts_(Focus)] banner.

Can typically be identified thanks to the attire's characteristics: a red [[fur trim]] [[dress]] with a green [[christmas tree]] pattern at the end, a [[santa hat]] with. a green and black [[ribbon]] with a [[bell]], a white [[belt]] with a [[satchel]], and a large [[sack]] on her back.

May be depicted holding her weapon: a small [[christmas tree]] decorated with [[christmas ornaments]] and a [[star]] on top.

Note that it's possible (especially for older artwork), to depict Nino in a winter outfit without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

Can typically be identified thanks to the attire's characteristics: a red and black [[bikini armor]] with a red and white [[cloak]], held together by a red and green [[ribbon]] (which also feature on her hips) with a small [[bell]], and fake [[antlers]] with [[christmas ornaments|ornaments]] at the ends.

May be depicted with her weapon, a silver [[candelabra]] with red [[candle]]s.

Note that it's possible (especially for older artwork), to depict Tharja in a winter outfit without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

Can typically be identified thanks to the attire's characteristics: black [[pantyhose]], a black [[leotard]] with a red [[underbust]] with [[gold trim]] that gives the impression of black diamond shapes, black and brown [[elbow gloves]], a large [[carrot]], a red [[choker]] with two yellow [[sash]]es, white [[rabbit ears]] with a [[hair flower]] or two, a red [[rope]] tied around the waist, and [[bare shoulders]].

title: micaiah_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Micaiah[/b] (ミカヤ) is one of the main protagonists of [[Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn]]. She is a light magician from Daein, a fortune teller, and a member of the Dawn Brigade (alongside [[Sothe (fire emblem)|]], [[Edward (fire emblem)|]], [[Leonardo (fire emblem)|]] and [[Nolan (fire emblem)|]]).

She is a patriot and loves her people. She will do anything that she can to help others: this, alongside her unusual abilities, made her something of a savior for Daein and earned her the titles "Silver-Haired Maiden" and "Priestess of Dawn". Usually seen alongside her bird companion [[Yune (fire emblem)|]].

h5.Appearance

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] (with a silver tone, usually with [[bangs]]) and [[yellow eyes]]. On the back of her right hand, Micaiah poses a [[birthmark]] that vaguely resembles a "bird":[/posts/3878648]. This mark is known as a "Brand" in the Tellius Games, usually hidden behind her gloves, and a recurring element in all of her outfits.

Her most known outfit ("Light Mage":[/posts/341896]) includes a [[sleeveless dress]] with [[side slit]]s, [[black leggings]] or a [[black pantyhose]] (depends on the art), [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless_gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]], a [[hair ribbon]], a [[blue scarf]], a [[belt]], [[bracelet]]s, and [[boots]]. 

Her second outfit ("Light Sage":[/posts/3839848]) incorporates many of the same design ideas, but changing the scarf for a [[blue cape]], her gloves (which are now [[purple gloves|purple]]) are also partially hidden behind [[long sleeves|long]] [[detached sleeves]] and her dress is [[pink dress|pink]] and has a [[turtleneck dress|turtleneck]].

Her third outfit, [[micaiah_(queen_of_dawn)_(fire_emblem)|Light Priestess/Dawn's Queen]], makes bigger changes to her design, almost completely removing aspects of Light Mage, including making this design [[bare_legs|legwearless]]; she now has a turtlenecked [[white dress]], a [[circlet]], her fingerless gloves resemble more [[bridal gauntlets]]. Like with Light Sage, she also has a cape, though in this case it is [[red cape|red]].

In Fire Emblem Cipher (and later Heroes) she has a fourth outfit, [[micaiah_(radiant_queen)_(fire_emblem)|Radiant Queen/Queen of Silver Shine]], which not only gave her a new color for a dress ([[black dress|black]]) is also gave her a [[red coat]]; like Light Priestess, it has a circlet (though with a more complicated design) and the bridal gauntlets.

Also from Heroes, she has appeared in some additional outfits; a [[micaiah (summer's dawn) (fire emblem)|butterfly-themed Yukata]], a [[micaiah_(bridal)_(fire_emblem)|wedding dress]] (alongside Sothe), a [[micaiah (wavecrest maiden) (fire emblem)|red bikini]], and a [[micaiah (ninja) (fire emblem)|ninja outfit]] (alongside Sanaki).

Voiced in Radiant Dawn's cutscenes, [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] and [[Fire Emblem Engage]] by [[Kuwatani Natsuko]] in Japanese portrayals. In English portrayals as of Heroes, she has been voiced by Veronica Taylor.

h4. Examples
* !post #341896: [[micaiah_(fire_emblem)|Light Mage]]  (default)
* !post #3839848: [[micaiah_(fire_emblem)|Light Sage]]
* !post #3597702: [[micaiah_(queen of dawn)_(fire emblem)|Light Priestess (Queen of Dawn)]]  
* !post #4742815: [[Micaiah (radiant queen) (fire emblem)|Radiant Queen]]
* !post #7677493: [[Micaiah (Dawning Maiden) (Fire Emblem)|Dawning Maiden]]
* !post #3218255: [[micaiah (summer's dawn) (fire emblem)|Hoshidan Summer Micaiah]]
* !post #3917439: [[micaiah (bridal) (fire emblem)|Bridal Micaiah]] (with [[Sothe (Fire Emblem)|]])
* !post #5438251: [[micaiah (wavecrest maiden) (fire emblem)|Summer Micaiah]]
* !post #6853063: [[micaiah (ninja) (fire emblem)|Ninja Micaiah]] (with [[Sanaki Kirsch Altina|Sanaki]])

[b]Starting Class:[/b] Light Mage

title: micaiah_(wavecrest_maiden)_(fire_emblem)
body:
Tag used for [[Micaiah (Fire Emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem]] specifically when dressed in her summer attire from the [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] 2022 "Summer Vacations":[https://feheroes.fandom.com/wiki/Summer_Vacation_(Focus)] banner, officially known as [b]"Micaiah: Wavecrest Maiden"[/b].

Can typically be identified thanks to the attire's characteristics: a [[red bikini]] which is a [[frilled bikini]] and has a [[bikini skirt]], red [[gladiator sandals]], a towel-like [[blue sash]], a white [[hair flower]] and a blue [[hair ribbon]] at the back of her head. May feature her weapon, a large [[clam shell]] with a [[pearl_(gemstone)|]] and a flower.

Note that it's possible (especially for older artwork), to depict Micaiah in a swimsuit without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

Don't confuse with [[Micaiah (summer's dawn) (fire emblem)|Micaiah: Summer's Dawn]]

title: elise_(tropical_flower)_(fire_emblem)
body:
Tag used for [[Elise (Fire Emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem]], specifically when dressed in her summer attire from the [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] 2017 "Nohrian Summer":[https://feheroes.fandom.com/wiki/Nohrian_Summer_(Focus)] banner.

Can typically be identified thanks to the attire's characteristics: a black and white [[one-piece swimsuit]], with pink [[frills]] at the hips, a [[flower wreath]] around her neck, and a pink [[bowtie]].

May feature her weapon: a [[book]] with a floral pattern on the cover.

The design of this outfit is identical to the swimsuit Elise wore in [[Fire Emblem Fates]]’ "Beach Brawl":[https://fireemblem.fandom.com/wiki/Beach_Brawl] DLC.

Note that it's possible (especially for older artwork), to depict Elise in a swimsuit without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

title: micaiah_(summer's_dawn)_(fire_emblem)
body:
Tag used for [[Micaiah (Fire Emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem]] specifically when dressed in her yukata attire from the [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] 2018 "Festival in Hoshido":[https://feheroes.fandom.com/wiki/Festival_in_Hoshido_(Focus)] banner, officially known as [b]"Micaiah: Summer's Dawn"[/b].

Can typically be identified thanks to the attire's characteristics: a [[red yukata]] with a [[butterfly print]] pattern all over it, as well a big [[blue bow]]. May feature her weapon, a [[kagura suzu]] known as the "Dawn Suzu".

Note that it's possible (especially for older artwork), to depict Micaiah in a kimono or yukata without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

Don't confuse with [[Micaiah (wavecrest maiden) (fire emblem)|Micaiah: Wavecrest Maiden]]

title: xander_(student_swimmer)_(fire_emblem)
body:
Tag used for [[Xander (Fire Emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem]], specifically when dressed in his summer attire from the [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] 2017 "Nohrian Summer":[https://feheroes.fandom.com/wiki/Nohrian_Summer_(Focus)] banner.

Can typically be identified thanks to the attire's characteristics: black [[swim trunks]] bearing the Nohrian crest.

May feature his weapon: a [[floatie]] shaped like [[Lilith (Fire Emblem)|]] in [[dragon]] form.

The design of this outfit is identical to the swimsuit Xander wore in [[Fire Emblem Fates]]’ "Beach Brawl":[https://fireemblem.fandom.com/wiki/Beach_Brawl] DLC. The Lilith-shaped floatie is also from that DLC.

Note that it's possible (especially for older artwork), to depict Xander in a swimsuit without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

title: cordelia_(fire_emblem)
body:
[i]"Our only limits are the ones we place on ourselves."
[/i] -During a support conversation with [[Sumia (fire emblem)|]]

[b]Cordelia[/b] (ティアモ, Tiamo) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]].

A beautiful Ylissean [[pegasus knight uniform (fire emblem)|Pegasus Knight]] who is also considered a genius. She also provides the basis of [[Caeldori (Fire Emblem)|Caeldori]] in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

She is voiced by Eimi Okada in the Japanese version and Julie Ann Taylor in the English version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: [[Pegasus Knight Uniform (fire Emblem)|Pegasus Knight]]

title: tharja_(summer)_(fire_emblem)
body:
Tag used for [[Tharja (Fire Emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem]], specifically when dressed in her swimsuit from the [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] 2023 "Summer Firsts":[https://feheroes.fandom.com/wiki/Summer_Firsts_(Focus)] banner.

Can typically be identified thanks to the attire's characteristics: a red [[o-ring bikini]] and a [[black cape]] with [[gold trim]], and [[sandals]]. Her [[tiara]] has been modified to depict a [[seashell]], and she now has a red [[hair flower]]. The design is overall very similar to the swimsuit she wore in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]]'s Summer Scramble DLC, including the cape (which appears to reference her CG being censored by a curtain in the western versions)

Note that it's possible (especially for older artwork), to depict Tharja in a swimsuit without it being the one described above (including the one in [i]Awakening[/i]), in which case this tag should not be used.

title: corrin_(female)_(novice_vacationer)_(fire_emblem)
body:
Tag used for [[corrin (female) (fire emblem)|Female Corrin]] from [[Fire Emblem Fates]] when dressed in her summer attire from [[Fire_Emblem_Heroes]]' 2017 "Nohrian Summer":[https://feheroes.fandom.com/wiki/Nohrian_Summer_(Focus)] banner. 

The Corrin unit using this outfit is officially known as [i]Corrin: Novice Vacationer[/i]

Can typically be identified thanks to the outfit's characteristics: a [[white_bikini]] with a [[front-tie top]] and a [[microskirt]] that's a [[bikini skirt]], a [[thigh strap]] that like the skirt has a [[black bow]], an [[anklet]] with a flower, a [[flower necklace]], and a black [[hairband]] with a purple [[hair flower]]. As is typical of Corrin, she is of course [[barefoot]].

Likely to include her weapon from the game, a blue picture [[book]] with marine life on the cover.

Note that it's possible (especially in older artwork) to depict Female Corrin in a swimsuit, without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

title: ushi_no_koku_mairi
body:
"Shrine visit on the hour of the ox". A Japanese ritual to curse someone to death. The person performing the ritual must dress in white, wear a tripod on their head holding three lit candles, and visit a shrine during the hour of the ox (1:00-3:00 AM). There, the person must nail a [[straw doll]] representing the target of the curse to a sacred tree using a five-inch nail. On the seventh day of performing this ritual without being discovered, the target will die.
Commonly associated with [[Mizuhashi Parsee]] due to the Bridge Princess character she's based on being the origin of the ritual, and one of her Spell Cards being named after it.

Since the image of a nail driven through a straw doll is ubiquitous to represent curses, this tag should be reserved for traditional portrayals of the ritual.

For another case where a character is wearing candles on their head (especially a number other than three), without the other parts of this ritual (i.e. no [[mallet]], [[hammer]], [[straw doll]], or [[nail (hardware)|]]s), it might instead be a reference to the youkai [[Hashihime]].

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia - Ushi no Toki Mairi":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ushi_no_toki_mairi]
* "Wikipedia (Japanese) - Ushi no Koku Mairi":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%91%E3%81%AE%E5%88%BB%E5%8F%82%E3%82%8A]
* "Pixiv Encyclopedia - Ushi no Koku Mairi":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E4%B8%91%E3%81%AE%E5%88%BB%E5%8F%82%E3%82%8A]

title: candle
body:
An object made of [[wax]] with a [[string]] running from top to bottom which is set alight. Its most common shape is cylindrical.

Has seen more use in the past, but it is still used as a [[light]] source in some places, in religious ceremonies and as a symbol of different things such as hope.

If the candles are worn strapped to the head with a [[headband]], there might be a reference to the youkai [[Hashihime]], or the curse ritual [[Ushi no Koku Mairi]] (which also involves a [[mallet]] or [[hammer]], a [[straw doll]] and [[nail (hardware)|]]s).

h4. See also
* [[candlelight]]
* [[candlestand]]
* [[candle wax]]
* [[chandelier]]
* [[lamp]]
** [[lamppost]]

title: hashihime
body:
A youkai from [[Japanese Mythology]]. Her name translates to "[[Bridge]] Princess". She is a jealous spirit depicted with a [[white robe]] or [[white kimono|kimono]] with [[fire|flaming]] [[candle]]s on her head. The origin of the story is unclear, but is believed to be based on a woman waiting for her lover to meet her under a bridge, only for him to run off with another woman. 

[[Mizuhashi Parsee]] is based on this character.

If the scene depicts a character with (especially three) candles on her head, with a [[mallet]] or [[hammer]] and [[nail (hardware)|]]s, and/or a [[straw doll]]. It is probably (also) a reference to the [[Ushi no Koku Mairi]] ritual, which involves cursing a person.

h4. External references
* "Wikipedia - Hashihime":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hashihime]
* "Wikipedia (Japanese) - Hashihime":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%A9%8B%E5%A7%AB]

title: pincers_(tool)
body:
A tool similar to [[pliers]] that is used to pinch, cut or pull an object.  They differ from pliers by concentrating the force to a point or edge that is perpendicular to the length of the tool.  They're designed so that the end of the jaws can be brought close to surfaces, such as when working to remove [[nail (hardware)|]]s from wood.

Pincers heated until they're [[glowing_hot|red hot]] have been used as a tool for [[torture]] since roman times.

h4. See also

* [[Tongs]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Pincers (tool)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pincers_(tool)]

title: curse_(pokemon)
body:
A move in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] media.

When Curse is used by a [[ghost]], the battle animation shows a [[nail (hardware)|]] piercing the user. This hurts the user and curses the target to lose HP each turn.

When used by a non-ghost, the user loses Speed, and its Attack and Defense rise.

title: feixianji_(hairstyle)
body: Traditional Chinese hairstyle. Translates to Flying Immortal Hair-coil. Two [[hair rings]] loop atop the head, similar to the Japanese chigomage, but unlike the chigomage, these hair loops are larger and looser, and incline towards the back of the head. They may resemble rabbit ears, or a bow. Another variant is the Chuihuan fenxiaoji, meaning hanging hair with split coil. These two hair rings drape over the side of the scalp, often creating [[asymmetrical hair]]. It's often associated with purity and virginity, as the hairstyle was worn by young maidens in the [[Tang Dynasty]]. h4. Examples * !post #7863326 * !post #7699346 * !post #7698825 h4. See also * [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]] * [[Shuangyaji]]

title: ping_pong_(manga)
body:
Ping Pong is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by Taiyō Matsumoto about table tennis. It was serialized in Shogakukan's seinen manga magazine Big Comic Spirits from 1996 to 1997. The story follows high schoolers and childhood friends [[Hoshino Yutaka|Peco]] and [[Tsukimoto Makoto|Smile]], compete in the national table tennis tournament where they face talented players from all over the country.

It was adapted into a 2002 live-action film. An anime television series adaptation called Ping Pong the Animation produced by Tatsunoko Production and [[Science SARU]], directed by Masaaki Yuasa was aired on Fuji TV's noitamina block between April and June 2014. It was notable for using rotoscoping, rather than more conventional anime art styles. 

h4. Characters
* [[Tsukimoto Makoto]], "Smile"
* [[Hoshino Yutaka]], "Peco"

title: qi_lolita
body:
Qi Lolita is a style very similar to [[Wa Lolita]] but instead of being inspired by the [[japanese clothes|Japanese traditional styles]], it is influenced by [[chinese clothes|Chinese traditional wear]] (e. g. [[china dress|Qipao]] or [[Hanfu]]), culture and other things related to the styles and influences.

Common features of Qi Lolita are [[mandarin collar]]s, [[Chinese knot]]s, [[tassel]]s, [[pankou]]s, [[side slit]]s over a petticoat and Lolita-style interpretations of the [[qixiong ruqun]]. 

h4. Examples

* !post #5075559: [[China dress]] inspired Qi Lolita
* !post #4705112: Qi Lolita with Qipao elements like [[tassel]]s and [[pankou]]s.
* !post #5543073: Qi Lolita based on [[qixiong ruqun]], with [[hagoromo]] and [[yunjian]]

h4. See also

* [[Lolita fashion]]
* [[tag group:Fashion style]]

title: ruru_(leedoppo)
body:

She is a [[Jeet Kune Do]] practitioner who has [[grey hair]] styled in [[quad tails]], held up by twin [[yin yang]] [[yin yang hair ornament|hair ornaments]]. Her eyes are [[yellow eyes|yellow]] and lined by a small crescent of [[eyeliner|red eyeliner]]. She wears a [[blue jacket|dark blue]] [[tangzhuang]] jacket with red [[pankou|frog buttons]] and a stylised yin yang symbol on the back, and a [[white shirt]] underneath. She wears matching [[blue shorts|dark blue]] [[shorts]] and black [[yoga pants]] adorned with [[dragon print]], and [[white footwear]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6122122

title: liv:_eclipse_(tiara)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Liv (pgr)|]]'s [[liv: eclipse (pgr)|Eclipse frame]].

The Tiara coating retains her [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] (less pink in tint/colouration) and [[pink eyes]], with the only head addition being a pair of [[fake animal ears|fake]] [[mechanical ears|mechanical]] [[deer ears]] over her own ears, and a white [[tiara]] with features similar to her default appearance headgear. Mechanical features around her body includes [[mechanical hands]] with [[doll joints]], [[mechanical legs]] and [[mechanical foot|feet]], as well as the midriff/stomach torso region being exposed [[mechabare]].

Her garments consist of two pieces. Upper body has a [[puffy long sleeves|long puffy sleeved]] [[white cardigan|white]] [[cropped cardigan]], has a white [[stole]] and a [[pink bowtie]] around the collar region, the cuff of the sleeves has [[layered sleeves|layered]] design.

Her lower body is a [[two-tone skirt|two-tone]] [[grey skirt|grey]] and [[white skirt|white]] [[high-waist skirt]] ([[gradient skirt]]) with [[layered skirt|layered]] and [[pleated skirt|pleated]] fabric designs. The skirt itself has three [[bow skirt|bows]], two [[grey bow|grey]] on the sides and one [[black bow]] on the [[back bow|back]].

body:
A frame of [[Liv (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
Empyrea can be identified by [[grey eyes]], [[medium hair|medium length]] [[white hair]] tied up in a [[braided bun]]. Hair ornaments includes a white [[hat]] in the form of a [[garrison cap]] and a [[x hair ornament|X shaped hair ornament]] fitted on her left [[sidelocks|sidelock]].

She wears a [[white dress|white]] [[collared dress]] with a [[black necktie|black]] [[short necktie]], has numerous [[wings]] shaped ornaments attached to the skirt ([[armored dress]]), a mechanical device on her lower back with [[multiple wings|multiple]] [[low wings|low back wings]], wears [[black gloves]] on both hands.

She can be depicted with a [[brooch]] on her chest and/or a [[mechanical halo]] floating [[halo behind head|behind her head]] depending on awakening level.

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[liv: empyrea (wings of dawn) (pgr)|Wings of Dawn]]

* "GrayRavens wiki - Liv: Empyrea Gallery":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Liv:_Empyrea/Gallery]

title: liv:_empyrea_(wings_of_dawn)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Liv (pgr)|]]'s [[liv: empyrea (pgr)|Empyrea frame]].

Wings of Dawn coating is more human like in appearance than the default Empyrea coating, retains the [[grey eyes]], [[white hair]] with [[braided bun]]. The overall hair length is now [[long hair|long]] due to two strands of hair at the back being excluded from the braided bun. A mechanical [[hair ornament]] ties the bun in place at the back, and a [[headgear]] with the appearance of a [[mechanical halo]] can be found on the top of her head, wears a singular [[star hair ornament|star shaped]] [[hairclip]] on her left sidelock.

Her outfit is a [[white dress|white]] [[armored dress]] with [[strapless dress|strapless]] design, it is decorated with wings, [[layered skirt]] and [[gold trim]] in various places. Other apparels include two sets of [[low wings]] are fitted on to  a device on her lower back and a pair of [[gauntlets]]. No apparels on her lower body.

She wields a [[staff]], followed by two floating [[non-humanoid robot|non-humanoid robotic]] [[drone]]s, and she herself is also often depicted [[floating]].

title: liv:_empyrea_(dreamcatcher)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Liv (pgr)|]]'s [[liv: empyrea (pgr)|Empyrea frame]].

Similar to the default Empyrea appearance, Dreamcatcher coating retains her [[grey eyes]] and [[white hair]], hair style is changed to the form of [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair]] with [[braid|braided]] [[half updo]], decorated with [[hair ribbon]]s, [[wing hair ornament]] and [[floating object|floating]] [[headgear]]s projecting a [[halo behind head|halo]] within.

Dreamcatcher's outfit consist of a [[black dress|black]] [[strapless dress|strapess]] [[medium dress]] with partially exposed [[crinoline]] structure. Other clothing elements include [[puffy detached sleeves]], [[detached collar]] with a [[black bowtie]], [[black wrist cuffs]], [[mechanical wings|mechanical]] [[butterfly wings]] and a pair of [[high heels|high heeled]] [[sandals]].

title: ayla:_kaleido_(pgr)
body:
A playable frame of [[Ayla (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
Introduced with the patch 'Renaissance du Fantastique', the Kaleido frame retains Ayla's [[pink eyes]] and [[pink hair]], hair style consist of [[low-tied long hair|low-tie]] [[long hair]] with two [[drill sidelocks]] elements. Wears a [[black hairband]], sometimes as [[rabbit ears]] [[animal ear hairband|hairband]] or another [[white headwear|white]] [[beret]] on top. Both of her arms are [[mechanical arms|mechanical]], attached above the elbow.

Her outfit consist of a mostly [[black overalls|black]] [[overall shorts]] and a [[black skirt|black]] [[showgirl skirt]], Kaleido frame is [[bare legs|bare legged]] except for two [[thigh strap]]s and a [[thigh pouch]] on the left leg. Uses a paint brush that looks like a [[staff]] in combat, sometimes depicted [[staff riding]] and/or with [[paint splatter]]s.

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[ayla: kaleido (morningstar) (pgr)|Morningstar]]


h4. External links
* "GrayRavens wiki - Ayla: Kaleido Gallery":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Ayla:_Kaleido/Gallery]

title: ayla:_kaleido_(morningstar)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Ayla (pgr)|]]'s [[ayla: kaleido (pgr)|Kaleido frame]].

The release coating with the Kaleido frame, keeping her [[pink eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]], and keeping the [[low-tied long hair]] style. Hair ornaments includes a [[white hairband]] and a [[white headwear|white]] [[garrison cap]] worn [[tilted headwear|tilted]] to the left, has a pair of [[round eyewear|round]] [[tinted eyewear]] [[eyewear on head|on her head]].

Body outfit consist of a [[white jacket|white]] [[collared jacket|collared]] [[backless jacket]] with a pair of [[pink shorts]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[thigh boots]]. Has a [[fanny pack]] to the right side of her waist, and wears a [[single glove|single]] [[black gloves|black glove]] on the right hand.

title: ayla:_brilliance_(pgr)
body:
A playable frame of [[Ayla (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
Ayla's Brilliance frame has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]], styled with a single [[braided sidelock]] on the right, her long hair ends in another [[braid]] at the back. Taggable bodily features includes: [[large breasts|large]]/[[huge breasts]], [[thick thighs]] and possibly [[skindentation]]s around the thigh caused by the [[thighhighs]].

She wears a [[dress]] with [[high-waist skirt|high-waist design]] and [[pleated skirt]]s, decorated with [[frills]] ([[frilled dress]]), typically depicted with a [[cleavage]] cut-out, [[long sleeves]] with [[wide sleeves|wide openings]]. Other clothing elements include: [[suspenders]], [[black ribbon]]s on the sleeves' upper arm, [[pink bowtie]], [[black thighhighs|full black]], or black and [[pink thighhighs|pink]] [[multicolored thighhighs ]], pair of [[black gloves]] that is both [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] and [[half gloves]] in design, wears a black [[beret]], uses a [[huge weapon|large]] [[scythe]] as her weapon.

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[ayla: brilliance (adventurous spirit) (pgr)|Adventurous Spirit]]
* [[ayla: brilliance (aster hare) (pgr)|Aster Hare]]
* [[ayla: brilliance (lost butterfly) (pgr)|Lost Butterfly]]

h4. External links
* "GrayRavens wiki - Ayla: Brilliance Gallery":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Ayla:_Brilliance/Gallery]

title: ayla:_brilliance_(adventurous_spirit)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Ayla (pgr)|]]'s [[ayla: brilliance (pgr)|Brilliance frame]].

Ayla had no significant bodily changes in the Adventurous Spirit coating, keeping her [[low-braided long hair|low-braided long]] [[pink hair]] with a single [[braided sidelock]] on the right and a [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow]] at the back. Changes being her eye colour being more [[purple eyes|purple]], a [[white headwear|white]] [[cabbie hat]], a pair of [[glasses]], and a [[white choker]]. There are no bodily mechanical elements on this costume.

Her apparels consist of a [[grey shirt|grey]] [[crop top]], a pair of [[black overalls|black]] [[overall shorts]] (has [[fur-trimmed shorts|fur-trimmed]] design), [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[blue sleeves]] with [[iridescent]] colourations, [[black gloves]], and a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[sneakers]]. On her [[black belt|belt]] attaches a [[camera]] and a [[transparent bag]], a [[trowel]] is attached to her right [[thigh strap]].

title: ayla:_brilliance_(aster_hare)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Ayla (pgr)|]]'s [[ayla: brilliance (pgr)|Brilliance frame]].

Aster Hare coating is a [[pink bodysuit|pink]] [[hooded bodysuit|hooded]] and [[armored bodysuit]], possibly qualifies for [[impossible bodysuit]] due to its [[skin tight]] nature around the breasts area. Ayla retains her [[pink eyes]] and [[pink hair]], hair style has a single [[braid]] on the left [[braided sidelock|sidelock]], though overall hair length is now indeterminable beneath the [[hood]].

The in-game official description suggests that this [[bodysuit]] outfit is a [[racing suit]].

title: ayla:_brilliance_(lost_butterfly)_(pgr)
body: [[Official alternate costume]] for [[Ayla: Brilliance (pgr)|]].

title: luna_(npc)_(pgr)
body: [[Luna (pgr)|]] as an Ascendant.

title: luna:_laurel_(fiery_moon)_(pgr)
body: An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Luna (pgr)|]]'s [[luna: laurel (pgr)|Laurel frame]].

title: luna:_oblivion_(pgr)
body: A frame of [[Luna (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

title: bambinata:_vitrum_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Bambinata (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
Bambinata's Vitrum frame is highly mechanized in appearance, overall shape is [[petite]], with the appearance of both a [[cyborg]] and a [[doll]]. She has [[two-tone hair|two-toned]] [[black hair|black]] and [[white hair]], hair style features two [[braided hair rings]] and [[blunt bangs]], hair accessories is either a [[hairclip]] or a [[heart hair ornament]]. She has [[blue eyes]] with [[heart-shaped pupils]] and facial [[freckles]].

Her torso is seemingly split into two halves with the internal [[mechabare]] and her [[mechanical spine]] exposed through the gap, she has ball joints ([[doll joints]]) at her neck, elbow and wrist, and she weapon is a pair of [[arm blade]]s concealed within her forearms similar to Cyberpunk 2077's Mantis Blades (See post #5604477). Other features include [[fake animal ears|fake]] [[cat ears]] and [[fake tail|fake]] [[cat tail]], giving her the appearance of a [[cat girl]].

Her wears a [[two-tone leotard]] ([[black leotard|black]] and [[white leotard|white]]) and a [[detached collar|detached]] [[frilled collar]] to hide her neck joint. Her forearm and lower leg is painted white and has blue [[argyle]] patterns painted on, which can be depicted by artists as [[argyle gloves|argyle]] [[elbow gloves]] and/or [[argyle socks|argyle]] [[kneehighs]].

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[bambinata: vitrum (swan lake) (pgr)|Swan Lake]]

h4. External links
* "GrayRavens wiki - Bambinata: Vitrum Gallery":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Bambinata:_Vitrum/Gallery]

title: bambinata:_vitrum_(swan_lake)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Bambinata (pgr)|]]'s [[bambinata: vitrum (pgr)|Vitrum frame]]. [[Cyborg]] in appearance.

Retains the same hairstyle and degree of mechanical body features, the Swan Lake coating retains Bambinata's [[petite]] body shape, [[blue eyes]] with [[heart-shaped pupils]], [[black hair|black]] and [[white hair|white]] [[two-tone hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and two [[braided hair rings]], the only hair ornament is now two [[black feathers|black]] [[feather hair ornament|feathers]]. The coating also removed her cat ears and tails.

All four of her limbs are mechanical and has [[see-through body]], inner [[mechabare]] can be seen, especially the retractable [[arm blade]]s on her forearms. Has ball shaped joints ([[doll joints]]) at her shoulders, elbows, wrists, knees and ankles, [[mechanical foot|mechanical feet]] has high heel elements.

Her apparel is a single [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] and [[backless dress]] with [[black collar]] piece.

title: qu:_pavo_(flawless_tempo)_(pgr)
body: An alternate outfit/coating of [[Qu: Pavo (pgr)|]].

title: qu:_pavo_(scarlet_spring)_(pgr)
body: An alternate outfit/coating of [[Qu: Pavo (pgr)|]].

title: cecilie_(pgr)
body: Cecilie is the [[humanoid robot]] that follows the construct [[alisa (pgr)|Alisa]] in [[punishing:_gray_raven|Punishing: Gray Raven]]

title: qu:_pavo_(pgr)
body: Playable frame of [[Qu (pgr)|]].

title: no._21:_xxi_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[No. 21 (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

In her XXI frame, 21 has [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]], depicted [[unkempt]], with features like [[long bangs]], long [[sidelocks]], [[hair intakes]] and a strand of [[ahoge]]. She has [[grey eyes]] but left eye is [[one eye covered|covered]] by a [[bandage over one eye|bandage]], skin complexion is relatively [[pale skin|pale]].

She wears a [[dress]] made up of a [[white unitard]] underneath and a front covering fabric piece, both sleeves are [[very long sleeves|very long]] and [[detached sleeves|detached]] from the dress, and very [[wide sleeves|wide]] in design. Wears a pair of [[gradient legwear|gradient]] [[pantyhose]], [[black pantyhose|black]] at the feet and [[white pantyhose|white]] towards the hips.

She is followed by a walking [[drone]] ([[No. 21's Buddy (pgr)|]]) and a [[floating object|floating]] drone, serves as her companion as well as combat.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4978823
* !post #4978824: [[no. 21: xxi (red hoodie) (pgr)|Red Hoodie]]
* !post #6815455: [[no. 21: xxi (solar frost) (pgr)|Solar Frost]]

h4. External links

* "GrayRavens wiki: No.21: XXI":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/No.21:_XXI]

title: qu:_shukra_(pgr)
body: A playable frame of [[Qu (pgr)|]].

title: no._21:_xxi_(red_hoodie)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[No. 21 (pgr)|]]'s [[no. 21: xxi (pgr)|XXI frame]], see post #4978824 for reference sheet.

The Red Hoodie coating retains her [[white hair]] though with indeterminable overall hair length as most of it is contained within the hood. Taggable hair features includes [[long bangs]] and [[hair between eyes]]. Both of her [[grey eyes]] are visible as opposed to the default XXI frame appearance. Her upper chest area has exposed [[clockwork]] mechanisms instead of human-like skin. Her back has exposed [[mechabare]] in the form of two brass pipes connecting back into her body and a brass colored [[mechanical spine]].

Her outfit is a [[hooded dress|hooded]] [[frilled dress]], with a [[red hood]] and [[very long sleeves]], the dress itself is of a [[backless dress|backless]] design, the cutout extends down to the lower back just above the buttock. White [[frills]] are fitted on various sections of the dress, on the [[frilled skirt|skirt]], and on the [[frilled sleeves|sleeves]]. The dress itself is also adorned with various ribbons ([[red ribbon|red]] and [[white ribbon|white]]) as well as brass clockwork instruments as well as two [[clock]]s. Her [[underwear]] is a pair of [[white bloomers]], it is partially visible due to her skirt length.

Her legwear is [[asymmetrical legwear|asymmetrical]], the left leg has a [[frilled legwear|frilled]] [[vertical-striped thighhighs|vertical-striped]] [[over-kneehighs|over-kneehigh]] secured by a [[garter straps|garter strap]], the right leg has a [[ankle socks|ankle length sock]] that is secured by a [[shin strap]] with another garter strap, the ankle high is also [[vertical-striped legwear|vertical-striped]], both legwear are [[gradient legwear|gradient colored]] from upper white to lower black. Her footwear is pair low-heeled [[black footwear|black]] [[dress shoes]] with a red ribbon on each shoe.

title: lucia:_dawn_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Lucia (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
Dawn can be identified by her [[twintails]] hair fitted with mechanical [[headgear]] as well as a singular [[x hair ornament]] on her left [[sidelocks|sidelock]], [[double-parted bangs]] with [[hair between eyes]]. Her twintails are [[multicolored hair|multicoloured]] [[gradient hair]], from [[red hair|red]] tips to [[black hair|black]] roots, red [[streaked hair|streaks]] can be found on her bangs and sidelocks. Other facial features include [[fake horns|fake]] [[grey horns]] shaped headgear, a pair of [[floating earring]], and a metallic [[chin guard]] armor.

She is fitted with two [[mechanical arms]] up to biceps, [[mechanical hands]] and [[mechanical foot|mechanical feet]]. [[robot joints|Robotic (hinge) joints]] connects her upper arms to her forearms, her legs connects to her torso via ball joints with a lot of [[mechabare|internal mechanical parts]] exposed when viewed from below. A device connects her [[katana]] to the back of her left forearm.

She wears a [[black dress|black]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[short dress]] with some [[cleavage]] and both [[bare shoulders|shoulders]] exposed. Legwear is [[asymmetrical legwear|asymmetrical]], consist of a [[black thighhighs|black]] [[single thighhigh]] on her right leg, a set of [[thigh strap]]s holding up a [[thigh pouch]] and a single [[knee pads|knee pad]] on her left leg. [[Skindentation]] is sometimes depicted around the thighhigh and thigh straps.

Though her weapon of usage is classified as a katana in game, her signature weapon has a unique appearance that may qualify it for the [[cutlass]] tag in artworks.

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[lucia: dawn (gray feathers: dawn) (pgr)|Gray Feathers: Dawn]]
* [[lucia: dawn (gothic) (pgr)|Gothic]]
* [[lucia: dawn (holiday of eden) (pgr)|Holiday of Eden]]

h4. External links
* "GrayRavens wiki - Lucia: Dawn Gallery":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Lucia:_Dawn/Gallery]

title: changyu:_qilin_(pgr)
body: A frame of [[Changyu (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

title: lucia:_dawn_(gray_feathers:_dawn)_(pgr)
body: An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Lucia (pgr)|]]'s [[lucia: dawn (pgr)|Dawn frame]].

body: [[Official alternate costume]] for [[Selena: Capriccio (pgr)|]].

title: lucia:_crimson_abyss_(final_journey)_(pgr)
body: [[Official alternate costume]] for [[Lucia: Crimson Abyss (pgr)|]].

title: selena:_tempest_(nightingale_and_rose)_(pgr)
body: [[Official alternate costume]] for [[Selena: Tempest (pgr)|]].

title: lucia:_dawn_(gothic)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Lucia (pgr)|]]'s [[lucia: dawn (pgr)|Dawn frame]]. [[Monochrome]] in coloration and [[cyborg]] in appearance.

Gothic coating has the exact same hair style as the Dawn frame, [[twintails]], [[double-parted bangs]] and [[long hair|long length]], though it is now entirely monochrome [[grey hair|grey]], the mechanical [[headgear]] above each twintails is replaced with two spikes that is [[obsidian rock|obsidian]] in appearance, the amount of [[x hair ornament]]s increased to five.

[[Grey eyes]], body has even lesser biological features, all four limbs are mechanical, both [[mechanical arms]] connects at the shoulder, both [[mechanical legs]] connects at the waist, [[mechanical foot|mechanical feet]] has built in high heels and limited ground contact area, possibly qualifies for [[fewer digits]] tag. Very exposed [[mechabare]] are on display, [[robot joints|robotic (ball) joints]] are visible at the shoulder, waist, knee and ankle, hinge joints at the elbow connects upper arm and forearm. A special device connects her [[katana]] to the back of her left forearm. A pair of [[low wings|lower back]] [[mechanical wings]] is present, but they are oriented to the left and can give off the impression of [[single wing]].

Very limited fabric can be found on the Gothic coating, a [[frilled collar|frilled]] [[detached collar]], a [[see-through skirt|see-through]] [[high-waist skirt]] with a lower back cutout, upper section of [[lace-trimmed thighhighs]] can be seen. Faint markings of [[barcode]]s can be found on her right thigh ([[leg tattoo]]) and on her left breast's fabric.

title: selena:_capriccio_(irisfall_ballad)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Selena (pgr)|]]'s [[selena: capriccio (pgr)|Capriccio frame]].

A coating released with the Capriccio frame itself, Irisfall Ballad is a formal [[white dress|white]] [[backless dress]] with [[detached collar|detached]] [[white collar]] with [[frilled skirt]] with a band of [[see-through skirt layer]]  underneath. Other clothing elements such as a [[blue bow|blue]] [[back bow]] that is detached and floating, and a pair of [[white gloves]].

Has similar physical appearance as the default coating, Irisfall Ballad kept her [[purple eyes]] and [[black hair]], hair style is now a [[updo]] [[hair bun]] with [[side braid]]s, adorned with [[pearl hair ornament|pearl]] and [[feather hair ornament]]s, wears a [[single earring|single]] [[floating earring|dangle earring]] with [[pearl earrings|pearl]] [[blue gemstone]] and a [[cross earrings|cross]] ornament. On top of her left arm being [[single mechanical arm|mechanical]], her right leg now also [[single mechanical leg|mechanical]].
